text: This was amazing- Everything we had was great! The Thoracian Clay Pot, Bulgarian Mixed Grill, and Bulgarian Biscuit Cake were awesome! Must stop if you are in Vegas!!

I've been hearing about this place for some time now and was excited to try it. It's crazy that it took us this long to make it here since it is a stone's throw from our house. We went for lunch and it was pretty empty with only one waitress working. She was attentive but as the place started to fill up she got a bit overwhelmed. The bread they bring is phenomenal and when paired with the oil and spices I felt like I didn't need anything else it was so good. I ordered the Chebureki (Georgian style, deep fried beef dumpling) for us to share; the dumplings were very tasty the beef was very flavorful. They reminded me of an empanada in shape and pastry but the taste was very different. For our main courses I ordered the Bulgarian Mixed Grill (3 sausages) and my bf ordered the Goulash. I liked two of the sausages a lot, the third was ok just not for me sadly I don't know which was which. The beans that are served with the dish are very good if not a bid over oiled, i did not care for the red dipping sauce it is served with. My bf's goulash was very tasty though the serving was small and it was a bit on the salty side. We really liked the atmosphere of the place, there is tons to look at, the discotheque music was terrible and if it weren't for that we probably would have stayed longer. All in all we will certainly be back if for nothing else then to try the yummy looking biscuit cake.

Not sure what their problem is but I wouldn't waste my time here. I am not one of those people who is impossible to please. I don't expect a lot. But I do expect the staff to not look at me like I'm crazy when I walk in the door. I also prefer a server to not huff and walk away when I say I've never been here before. 

I walked into this place and the bartender looked at me like I have 3 heads or something. I just finished work. I'm a real estate agent and just wanted a little happy hour before going home. I can assure you, I don't have 3 heads, and I don't go to bars looking like a crazy person. I'm not sure why they seemed so shocked I went in their establishment. Maybe they don't like single female customers? Maybe they expected me to speak Russian? Who knows. 

The other bartender stuck a menu on my bar table and asked if I had been here before. I said no. She huffed and walked away. What is that?? 

I sat there for a minute, decided I prefer to spend my money and time at an establishment where I at least don't get looked at like I have boogers hanging out my nose or something. And walked out. 

Bartender who gave me crazy eye asked if I didn't like the menu. Actually I was very interested in the menu. I just wasn't interested in the attitude. 

Maybe they are having an off day. 

The only people in the place at 5:30 were an old man who looked like he parks in that same chair all day everyday, and an older woman who strolled out of the bathroom with a sour look on her face, picked up a glass from the old guy's table, and walked outside without a word. 

I too walked out without a word.

I love everything about this place except their slow service, which is why I'm only giving it a 3 star.  Their food truly is exceptional, but their service need some improvement.  I've been here a few times, even at nights less busy, and have always gotten the same service.  Slow and inattentive staff.

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE!  

Forte has an awesome euro-vibe: hip and so authentic.  My husband and I go about once per week and we haven't even come close to trying everything on the menu.  Some of our favorites...patatas bravas, tuna-stuffed tomato with hard-boiled egg, sofiiska baniza (feta-stuffed pastry), queso manchego canapes, stuffed peppers, stuffed cabbage...  Actually, I could just go on and on...oh the lattes, too - fabulous!

Elizabeth M. really captured the spirit of Forte in her review so I won't repeat, but I agree with everything she's written.  And after reading Adam's review, I am thrilled that he won't be at Forte when I go tonight!!

I am so glad we discovered Forte.  It is our favorite place BY FAR to just go hang out and casually enjoy a delicious meal.

Amazing stroganoff ragu with perfect balanced seasoning. Great on the fries and on the dumplings. The Russian dumpling are tender tasty and impossible to stop eating.  Cordial staff. Good drinks. And live music come the weekend. Don't miss this place. 

Get lots of dishes and share.

5 stars all around! Everything we ordered was superb - service was excellent,  drinks (nice wine display) and more! Come to Forte with friends, on a date, or solo - JUST GET HERE! You will not be disappointed :-)
food was very good service a little slow due to only one waitress as i went on my lunch time, would definatiley go back.
Best chicken kabob i have had in the USA...comes with this amazing rice...Lamb was also equally good......try their gypsy (secret) cocktails

I made a reservation after hearing raving reviews from family and colleagues. Took a taxi out from The Strip where I was staying due to a conference. Arrived to find a hastily handwritten scrawled note on the door saying their were closed for a private party. They could have called me to save me the trouble of traveling out there. But they didn't. Very disappointing and unprofessional. Too bad as this was going to be a business expense and I had a large party.

I learned about this place from Desert Companion (KNPR's magazine). Tried it out with the bf on a Thursday night (around 9pm) and we're still talking about it. 

Ordered:
Gambas al Ajillo (shrimp with garlic, wine, olive oil)
Calamares Rellenos en su Tinta (marinate baby squid in ink over rice)
Beef and Lamb Confit
Vareniki (potato + onion dumplings)
Adjarski Khachapurri (soft bread boat filled with cheese + egg)
Tolumba (fried dough bathed in honey)
Ginger Lemonade (like a gingery mojito with a hint of rosemary)

All the dishes were standard tapas portions (except that bread boat) and completely delicious. I'm lactose intolerant and not a big fan of meat. Despite that, there were still plenty of items for me, plus some mighty tasty drinks. I couldn't eat the Adjarski Khachapurri because of the cheese, but judging from the single crumb left by my bf, it was pretty good.

We sat outside at roomy, slightly wobbly tables. Ice water was brought without us asking, service was consistently good, as are prices. The only downer was the cigarette ash that was left on our table when the hostess took the ashtray away. Nobody came to clean it off so we shifted to the next table.

We'll definitely be back to try everything that we didn't get around to trying the first time.
Amazing small portions of food.. Great service, live music, good looking ambience, good on pricing.

The place gets 1 star for several reasons, most of all for trying to serve crap under the guise of freshly prepared tapas. One such example is their so called spanish tuna which they get from the can and afterwards add some sliced tomatoes and serve it to customers. I come from a cultural background where many of those eastern European dishes are common in our household so I know what those things ought to taste like, I cant say they were terrible but it was definitely not worth the price. Also having gone to Barcelona myself their so called jamon iberico was just another sliced up pork and nothing like the iberico from Spain. The squid stuffed with its ink came semi warm and had a nasty fish taste to it rather than what they make you believe. a combination of bad food, bad service, trying to make you believe that their food is something it's not (dishonesty) gets this place the 1 star review. It's no wonder that we were the one of two tables occupied in the whole place. Stick with firefly and your will be a lot more happier.

This place is great food was really really good the drinks for amazing the people there are great I know it's a family run restaurant and they really take care of you the owner came to over table and said hello greeted us the Decour is really nice and they were very helpfulin recommending some of the dishes. I would absolutely go there again we were actually planning to spend over New Year's there.

I was asked if is like to sit at the bar and I did. The bar is very uncomfortable so I moved to a high top table nearby. I sat for 20 minutes with no menu or anything. Both servers walked past numerous times without even looking my direction. There were only four or five other tables in the place.

I have been a server and can overlook a lot of things, but this was unacceptable. I finally left and as I walked past the host/server at the front, she said nothing.  I'm sad because the online menu looked excellent, but I am so peeved at the service that I don't think I will ever return.

Forte needs to learn how to treat a customer!  Also,I would have given it zero stars if yelp would let me. Stay away!

My wife and I eat at Forte every time we visit Las Vegas, and the food is very good. However, our most recent visit will be our last. We had an excellent lunch and we left an 18 percent tip. When we received the charge on our credit card, 52 cents was added to the tip. I generally tip up to the dollar, so it was not an addition mistake. I called the restaurant twice and asked for the manager to return my call. None was forthcoming. The restaurant experience goes beyond the food, and if a restaurant can condone adding money on to a tip and the management can't give a customer a return call, it doesn't deserve my business.

I never reviewed any place before, but this experience was so bad that I had to. The one star is only because there was no option for no stars. 

Horrible service!!!!
We were sat down and waited for a very long time till we even got asked for drinks. I ordered something and was brought another thing. That can happen, but when we asked about the difference between the Serbian and the Bulgarian Grill (just because it was our first time there and we are not familiar with serbian or bulgarian food and the description on the menu was a different language)  the answer was "it's just different sausages" and then she rolled her eyes. This is what made me write the review. That was so rude!

Overpriced considering the size of the portions and I paid for a drink that I never had, which I didn't even mentioned because by that time I just wanted to get out of there.
Really good unique dishes and friendly staff. Very cozy inside too. I went with a friend and ordered several items from the menu. Everything was great.

We decided to have a late night appetizer so we decided to stop into this establishment.  Upon entry we were welcomed by a sweet hostess and friendly waiter.  They have a great variety of dishes to choose from, but we selected a few.  We tried: 

MIxed Tapas Plate
Pitcher of Sangria
Stuffed Grape Leaves
Chicken Shich Kabob
and for dessert...
Tiramisu with Baileys coffee easy whip ;)

I thought the Mixed Tapas plate was mediocre and not as exciting as the establishment's environment.  The tasty kabobs, flavorful grape leaves and striking sangria definitely made up for it.  I would go back to try other items on the menu, but would definitely order the sangria and grape leaves again!

I can't say enough good things about Forte. Went there tonight with my wife.  We both thought the food was great, service was great and the price of the meal was so reasonable.  Our waiter answered questions, made thoughtful recommendations, and was attentive to our needs.  We shared the bacon wrapped dates, a great cucumber, tomato feta salad, the clay pot dish and assortment of Bulgarian sausage.  The food was perfectly seasoned and very tasty.  It is well worth the cab ride to get off the strip and have a great ethnic meal.  Our whole meal only cost $35 and was just right for two.  We well definitely return when we are in Vegas and recommend it to friends and family.

Awesome cocktails and Eastern European tapas!  Service is excellent and owner is so accommodating and sweet. Definitely one of the great hidden gems in Las Vegas.  Definitely recommend Gypsy Milk cocktail and Sweet Peppers.

We tried this place because we saw it on "Triple D" and we really enjoyed it. I must say that I had never eaten Bulgarian food and I have a feeling that I might not always like it which says even more for this place. It was very good, not normally the kind of food I'd like but very tasty. My wife liked it even more than I. I don't even remember what we had, I do know hers was in one of those little clay pots. Both of us were quite impressed. It had a friendly, "local dive" atmosphere too. I can imagine that every person of Bulgarian decent must surely come eat at this place. We recommend it.

On the whole, this restaurant does give a new patron a great slice of  European cuisine and it is worth noting that if you've never been here before that you should try it out because most of the food as it is now is delicious, but having been here in the past and knowing what these foods really were has really soured my experience.

It's been a long time since I had been back to this place since its first inception. Back then this place was one of the only occupied storefronts in a dead strip mall. This place had a menu that was meat and cheese heavy and showcased a wide assortment of Eastern Bloc varieties.

The appeal of this place in addition to the great food was the tell tale sign of a great hole in the wall joint: Authentic European food, sketchy European groups of men and women engaging in non-English conversation and a woman running the show who knew what was good and made sure you ate it.

The most notable things were:

Shopska salad
-It has the creamiest Bulgarian feta cheese. Don't mistake this feta for Greek feta. This is incredible.

Cevape
-Homemade fat finger sized sausages served with lepina, a type of yeasty flatbread.

Artisian Charcuterie Plate/Cheese Plate
-These 2 are definite musts for light eating and drinks

Leskovacka pljeskavica
-similar to the cevape in flavor but served like an over sized burger

There were also a few kabob-like meats and a few other sausages similar to the cevape that were so delicious.

So why the poor rating? Mostly due to the fact that what I described is what I was hoping to find on this most recent visit today.

Our waiter informed us that he was brand new and didn't know much of the menu or the wine selection. He also pointed out on each trip back to our table that nobody was assisting him as he was learning. I'll point out here that for whatever reason he was not our waiter by the end of our meal.

We got the Beef Stroganoff Ragu, Thracian Clay Pot, Chicken Soup, Chebureki, Bacon wrapped dates and the Beef and Lamb Confit. We were really interested in the Thracian Clay Pot as it was recently featured on a Food Network show.

The Stroganoff was ladled over wild mushroom plemeni, a kind of Russian tortellini. This stroganoff had a lot of creamy goodness but was completely lacking the meat.

I'll get to the Thracian Clay Pot shortly. The Chicken Soup was desired by my kids ages 8 and 6, as well as the bacon wrapped dates. The chicken soup was quite chunky with big chicken flavor. The first round of dates looked like they spent about 1 minute too long in the pan where one side was cooked good the other burnt. We were informed that the cook likes to cook it that way to which our reply was, "Please give us unburned bacon wrapped dates." They were very good about getting this order back after the rest of our items had come out.

The Chebureki was akin to a samosa where it is a flattened dough item filled with something and deep fried in this case, a delicious meat filling and topped with some dill and chopped scallions. Fairly standard in flavor and not served with any type of dipping sauce.

The Beef and Lamb Confit was tender and tasty served atop a small scoop of a dill and scallion rice. While this was tasty it was not a distinct one. My son said, "Is this corned beef?" And you know what? He was right. It did taste a lot like the type of corned beef I'd find in a chunky hash at Hash House a go-go. But that's for another review.

So now back to the Thracian Clay Pot. It would seem that during the shuffling of waiters for our table, either our waiter put in this order incorrectly or it was given to another table because we didn't get it during the course of them bringing the rest of our order. When we questioned why the long wait, we were told that it takes a while. We didn't get it after an hour after initially ordering and 30 minutes after reordering it. So I can't tell you how melty and delicious it looked and how it would taste, but the table next to us seemed to really enjoy it.

I'm not a vodka drinker so please read the other ratings for their extensive vodka menu.

This still doesn't really warrant the low rating based on the food. Where it really lacked was the overall experience now versus where it was. This place used to have people who knew the food, wasn't afraid to give locals some food they couldn't pronounce and keep true to themselves. Now, there are waitstaff that don't know the product and don't make you feel excited about their food.

If your looking for something new in Vegas and haven't been, your experience will most likely be 4-5 stars. It is not something that you will find anywhere else and that makes it unique. You will not have the displeasure of seeing a restaurant jump the shark.

This place was amazing, great food. We had the clay pot , stuff dates with bacon are my favorite, lots of flavor.. We also tried the Octopus in olive oil- amazing! Bulgarian mixed grill was fantastic.. Definitely will be coming back.. If your in Vegas, this a restaurant you must try..

How many times can we come here and have the best experience ever! Just stopping in for "a beer" is impossible! You feel like you've entered another world in here...someone's super cool Eastern European home OMG I love it! And they remember us and our names! I have been here 7 times but the last time was about 6 months ago and they STILL REMEMBER US! They treat us like family now. So after about three hours and tons of food and drink later I can't help but think this place just exceeds all expectations. My favorite in Vegas with a great ambiance, fab music and Ivo! Our favorite on the wait staff...since he was the first we met at the bar when we first stumbled in here and still today...feels like our long lost brother!!!!! We won't be leaving any time soon! xoxoxoxo

Thanks DDD for bringing this restaurant into the spotlight! It has old-warm charm and delicious food that keeps bringing me back.

The bread and olive oil is a great starter; the fries with feta are delish, but I love the crusty pastry with the egg and cheese filling best-Adjarski Khachapurri. It's like the most wonderful personal fondue.

Oddly enough- the truffled mashed potatoes are also out of this world.

The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the charred onions on the pierogis- I love onions but these were a little too burnt each time I ordered the dish.
Forte continues to get better each time I visit. The decor is really nice.The Chicken Soup is the best in town. A real find. One of Las Vegas' best.

The menu is eclectic Eastern European, which is confusing because the name including the word "Tapas" is irrelevant.  Should be called, "Bulgarian Meze Bistro" instead.  Anyway, the food was excellent, the service was solid and ambience was "meh".  The food is all home cooked, excellent flavors but smaller than usual portions.  If you're order the grilled lamb chops you need to order 2 dinners because each dinner provides only 2 chops; there should be 3-4 chops per dinner.  Chicken shish kabob was delicious, but again, only one small skewer with perhaps 6 small square pieces of chicken.  Goulash was good; braised lamb very good; skirt steak good.  The mixed meat grills, whether Serbian or Bulgarian are 100% pork and they will NOT substitute.  If you are a pork lover, enjoy; if not and you're looking for beef kabobs or beef  and lamb koftas, you must go somewhere else.  Too much pork on the menu.
Flavor wise - all dishes were delicious but over priced for the portions.
Bomb food don't know much about Eastern Europe but I know they eat damn tasty viddles. Clay pot was so good worth the wait both the Serbian and Bulgarian mixed grill are must try's.
Will not return.  Food was lacking in flavor, as well as being brought to the table in a haphazard way.

Outstanding!!!  The food was amazing!  We ordered the shrimp appetizer, Gambas al ajillo, the octopus, the Bulgarian mixed grill and the Thracian clay pot.  All we're full of great flavors!  Our waitress, Blanca, was bubbly and friendly but also attentive and professional. The.decor was an interesting eclectic style and added a great personality.  Aces all around. Find this place and eat here. You will not regret it.

Get the stroganoff fries!  The pljeskavica is outstanding. The homemade bread dipped in olive oil with spice are excellent.  The stroganoff is amazing.  The shopsha salad is great.  Eat here!  You're welcome.

The first rule to keep customers coming back is to not do false advertisement.

I want to share my experience so this doesn't happen to anybody else again

The have a board where they write the "beer" of the day and it was advertised Kanika for 4 Dollars, we order several of the "4" dollar beers pointing to the board when talking to the waiter. when they brought the check the beers were marked at 6 dollars on the check. We asked the waiter and she said that kanika had 4 different beers and she brought us the one marked as 6 dollars, so she was charging us 6 instead of 4. I told her that the beer was advertised as 4, and she said yes but its actually 6. 

even is 1 dollar or 2 dollars more than advertised.. is still fraud.. if they do this with beer I can not even start to imagine what they do when they cook

I am defensibly sharing my experience with all people to prevent this from happening again

Shameful

Las Vegas Local !

Absolutely the best restaurant we ate in vegas.  We had the mixed grill plus added the other 2 sausages that didn't come on it, the clay pot, chicken soup, chebureki, and baklava.  The service is fast, friendly,  and helpful.  Everything we ate was delicious.   On the table is this spice mix and I suggest putting it on everything!   I bought some to use at home.  Anytime we are in vegas we are coming here and I suggest you do the same.

absolutely amazing as always. ive been coming in for about a year and the service food and drinks are always great. prices are fair but the owner will make u the best drinks u have ever had, not to mention her awesome paintings through out. 

well worth the visit.
Can't miss here.  Everything is delicious and everyone that works here is kind and hospitable.  I don't live in Las Vegas, but sure gives me a few really compelling reasons to want to :)

We went on Friday night and we're able to get a table despite not having reservations. FYI reservations are recommended for Friday and Saturday nights.  Great date night atmosphere ..dark cozy and comfortable.  There was also live music which was great because it wasn't ridiculously loud - you could still carry on your conversations.  I had a delicious cocktail that came in a copper mug - can't remember the name of it - it had ginger infused vodka, lime and ..? We'll worth the eight dollars.  Home made bread was excellent - the olive oil was top quality - reminded me of the olive oil that you get in Greece.  The feta cheese pastry was like a dessert.  The meat dumplings were good they were very meaty -almost games which I wasn't I the mood for at the time but they were delicious regardless.  Bacon wrapped Marcona almond stuffed dates were yummy and the biscuit cake dessert was as delicious As it sounds.

Heard about Forte's from Guy Fieri and I have to say he did not disappoint.  I am always looking for something different and reasonably priced. The food was fantastic.  This was my first visit so I ordered the Bulgarian Mixed Grill which had 3 different types of sausage all made from scratch and delicious.  It came with a white bean salad and a tomato sauce dip.I  rate that dish 10 for 10..
The waitress suggested I try the Vareniki which was a potato dumpling with fried onions and OMG she was right another hit.  Food was soo good I had to bring my room mate home some Beef Stroganoff and Baklava for both of us.  Did I mention the atmosphere and service were great also and we sere surprised with some entertainment also..I will be returning to try other things on the menu... By the way everything was priced reasonably with good portions.
Great place! Yummi food!! The biscuit cake is delicious, save some room for it! Good staff and cozy atmosphere!

I love here :) try an European foods!!
They have various foods and staffs are kind :-) Definitely I'll come back

The first thing they do is bring out a huge bottle of vodka... filled with water. That just sets a mood for the rest of your meal :)
The little place in the strip mall in Las Vegas is totally worth the trip - the Eastern European decor with stuff everywhere will keep you busy while your order comes up. 
Our waitress was absolutely amazing - attentive but not overbearing, willing to bring tastes of wine and to recommend the best options on the menu. 
We tried five different dishes, but Sofiiska Baniz and Bulguarian Mixed Grill stood out to me. 
I would go back to this place in a heartbeat.

I've been to Forte three times now and have not had a bad experience.  Here's the deal though, going to Forte is a different cultural experience and is not going to be comfortable for people who are expecting an Americanized Eastern European restaurant.

What I like about this place is the great, very European vibe it has - pulled together, comfortable, eclectic, loungy.  This place is very versatile with an ample porch, a great bar (I will say the bar stools are not great.) and a dining room with a variety of tables.  The walls are covered with a variety of odd and, lets say, eclectic art that would make any hipster coffee shop proud.

I find the staff pleasant and helpful and always willing to give you a recommendation from a menu that is unfamiliar to most.

The food is very comfortable and, to my taste, good.  Things Americans will perhaps know include Beef Stroganoff, Kebabs, and Hungarian Goulash.  Things less familiar will be Plov, a dish of rice cooked with meat and carrots, and Katchapourri, a bread bowl with cheese and an egg.  

The thing that gives this place the 4 stars, along with the atmosphere, is the bar.  On tap, they have Pilsner Urquell, Stella Artois, Sam Adams Seasonal, and Blue Moon for beers and a variety of Russian and others in bottle.  The bar is extensive and all is quality - I don't think I've seen a mid-range bar without plastic-bottled well liquors or even lower-end standards, such as Jim Beam and Wild Turkey.  Also, at Forte, they macerate a variety of fruits in vodka and brandy, and they are great!  I particularly like the Sour Cherry Vodka and the Gypsy Concentrate.

One final note is the pricing, which is great!  My last bill included two appetizers and two entrees, a draft, two double Knob Creeks, and four Sour Cherry Vodkas (full rocks glasses with ice) for a total with tip of $55.  As much as I love Herbs and Rye and Nora's, the same bill would have been doubled.

So, if you're interested in a really good, pretty authentic Eastern European bar/lounge/coffee shop/dining experience, go to Forte.

Heard about this restaurant on diners drive-ins and dives wanted to try it out I was not disappointed excellent food good service great menu selection. I would recommend this to anyone who visits Las Vegas.

Hubby and I have been trying to stop by this place for awhile since seeing it on Triple D.  What a disappointment.  We went on a Saturday and even though the sign said it was open, the restaurant did not open until noon.  Ran errands and returned to some very spotty service.  We had to ask for water refills and the deal breaker is having not bringing both dishes out at the same time.  We'd never been to this place and it would have been nice if the server would have explained what some of the dishes were before just leaving it up to their menu descriptions but she was in somewhat of a hurry since it appeared she was the only server.

Not likely to return but glad we went there to try.  A little pricey for what we got but you live and learn.

I absolutely love this place! The Easter lamb, the Kachapurri, Thracian clay pot are favorites. Great wine selection and cool atmosphere. This is one of my regular places and has been for the last year. Highly recommended!

We checked this place out after seeing it on Diners Drive Ins and Dives. The reviews were good, it was down the street and my parents were visiting so free babysitting! We started off with a couple house beers which were very good. The bread they brought out was good but the oil and herbs to dip it in were amazing!!  We ordered one of the items we saw on the show which was also very good. Then had some meat dumplings which were excellent but the little trimmings on top really made it unique. We would go back for all of it but the just like dessert stuffed, bacon wrapped dates were out of this world!! The food was fresh and hot. The staff nice and friendly. Its a great place to just enjoy your meal, not be bothered too much and it's inexpensive. Smaller restaurant so would probably be fun to go with a couple other friends and just linger over dinner.  2 beers, bread, dates, meat dumplings and meat plate was only $36. We would definitely go back and bring friends.

Amazing food! Just happened to google places in Vegas that happened to be showcased on the Food Network. Found this place by chance and we weren't disappointed!! Ordered the Bulgarian grilled meat plate, lentil soup and the shrimps cooked with garlic. Everything was amazing! Lentil soup was vegetarian yet so tasty. The shrimps cooked to perfection (not rubbery). The meat plate was so full of flavor! A definite favorite. Will have to come back and try the clay pot and the octopus!! The price was great also! So much food!!

Spring Valley makes a comeback. I fell in love with this place. My friend i and wanted to try it out and loved to local non-corporate feel of the place. I love that they have an ice chest chilling beer on tap in the front.

Food was great - Had the tripe soup, lamb confit and greek grilled plate and fries. soup was ok. lamb was very good. grilled plate great. fries to die for.

Wines here are cool but not over priced. not a bottle over $80. a lot of east european wines too. average per bottle is around $50 and the beers you cant get anywhere else. try the infusions as well

Services was a bit lacking. never knew who my server was but i think one of the managers or owners keep coming by. she was a red head but didn't think that she was a waiter.

If any of you remember a place called Jazzed on East Trop or Durango and Sahara...then this place has the same feel but not italian

Nice atmosphere, a little tight but cozy place. Happened to see this place show cased on Triple D (Food Network) so figured might as well give it a shot while I was in Vegas. Food is different but tastes great. Portions are a bit small and you may end up spending more than you'd like but it's a nice experience trying something different. Feta cheese fries were awesome. Not the kind of food you eat every day but you'll become a bit more cultured after experiencing. Give it a shot you won't be disappointed.
located in a strip mall this small funky place has some interesting food. Well made, fresh ingredients make Forte a place we will certainly go back to. Live music, great people make it even better!

My BF and I discovered this place accidentally, and loved experiencing the Russian (and nearby) cultural impact on their food and drink offerings.  It's not all swanky-looking inside, and I liked it better that way.  It was just very genuine.  We'll be going back!

Tapas menu has Russian, Mediterranean, and Spanish influences - quite a wide range.  

They make their own flavor-infused vodkas and absinthe too!

Delish. Although we did not know all the menu items, Ilko was an amazing help. He pointed us in all the right directions. GET THE BISCUIT CAKE FOR DESSERT!!! confit, dates, fried dumplings n strog fries are highlights! Very much recommend & will return asap. Tapas are small so 2 people shared 5 & a BISCUIT CAKE! totally blown away by that dessert!

I don't like wobbly chairs and tables and that's what they have here. Menu doesn't explain well what stuff is and I came for tapas but tapas that I like not to try some new form of meat.  Waitress was real pushy to have me get things she liked and I said no and she said "I thought you came here to try something new" and I said "not at all I came here to get food that I know I like and want".
The food I ordered was pretty good but what a painful process to get it.
I may come back but not without trying other tapas in the area first.

This Beautiful Authentic Gem is the best kept secret in Vegas.  The body and mind are lifted the second you walk in the door. The Food is made with integrity and Love. When the food is prepared with this much love, you can taste it in every bite!

Delicious, great atmosphere, small business, unique beer and alcohol selection, unique foods, perfection.

Get the stuffed dates, stuffed grape leaves, garlic fries, and the cheese filled bread boat with egg on top. You will be ADDICTED. 

I can't say enough good things about this place! It's a hole in the wall that feels like a Vegas secret.
Debated about 4 or 5 stars and leaned towards 5, as you don't see these types of cuisines around that much. Like the others it was really great food.

Absolutely love this place. Wish I had found it sooner. Had lamb chops and Goulash. Both were spot on

Friendly staff and great service. 
Great looking place too
Loved everything ! Had the sausage plate which was out of this world flavor and the beans were incredible! Also had lentil soup which rivaled my own.

Incredible!  Every dish we ordered, from the lentil soup to the Thracian Clay Pot was delicious.  We were in Vegas for 4 days and ate here twice, it was so good.  I'm going to be thinking about their sausages and stuffed peppers until our next trip back.  To top it all off, the service was perfect.  Nataliya made us feel welcome and helped us through the menu, since we had never had Bulgarian food before.

First time here. Had an anniversary meal with family. Very nice atmosphere and wonderful service. Never had Bulgarian food before so this was a great experience. Drinks are a little pricey but the food is very reasonably priced. The cheese and jelly platter was tasty but small. Main courses were excellent and bountiful. Particularly enjoyed the lamb dish and sausage mixed plate. Definitely worth a trip. Everyone must try the biscuit cake for dessert.

The mix grill is phenomanal, has to try! Lutenitza with feta is also a must from the appetizers. Home made bread with olive oil and traditional spice mix. I'm loosing my mind. This place is unbelievable. If you are going to Vegas you MUST stop to try it at least once !!!!!!!

Ignore the dodgy location, as that is the only thing about this place that isn't A+. This isn't a place that mascarades as European cuisine, it truly has all the old world flavor, and you can taste the love that goes into each and every dish. 
They have a nice selection of artisan beers and you can even just sit at the bar(I've been known to do so). Every single waitress is so gracious and kind. 

Incidentally, I once had a friendly cab driver bring me home from the airport and as we passed Forte, I mentioned that it was a great place to eat. He said, "Yes, I know.... my wife is cook there". 
Vegas really is a small town.

I was ever so privileged to experience Forte Tapas for the first time last night. The menu is easy to read and the options are pretty straight forward. I ordered the Lentil Soup which was delicious! I also shared with my friend the Chicken Kabab plate and an order of the Chorizo con Vino. Everything was amazing. The flavors are indescribable and the Baklava and the "Biscuit" which is their version of the traditional Tiramisu is a lack of a better word. I'm so excited about this new found restaurant.

If you're visiting Las Vegas and you never leave the Strip, then you have no business complaining about overpriced mediocre food.  If you want something different, then drive or Uber it over to Forte.  There are things on the menu that I've never seen elsewhere.  Yeah, the service is a little slow, but then again no one is rushing you out the door.  

We showed up at 7:30 on a Wednesday for dinner.  Unfortunately, I went overboard with the delicious bread and even more delicious olive oil dip.  There is a container of spices at each table.  You pour some olive oil into a plate and sprinkle some of the spices on top before dipping your bread.  I don't know what combination of spices are used, but it was an entirely new taste sensation.

We started with the sofiiska baniza (feta cheese rolled in filo dough) that was a bargain at $7.  We also ordered the stuffed dates.  The jerez sherry reduction drizzled over them was perfect.  Lea had the beef and lamb confit and I ordered the bulgarian mixed grill,  Both were great, though after all that bread I couldn't finish the last piece of sausage.

We decided to stop for lunch on our way out of town two days later.  This time, I controlled my bread intake.  Once again, we ordered the dates and each had the beef and lamb confit.  Absolutely delicious.  Before leaving, we bought a jar of the spices.

If you're in Vegas, it's well worth the cab fare to enjoy a meal at Forte.
This is one of my favorite restaurants of all time. If you come here get the thracian clay pot. Its so filled with flavor.

Food and wine is excellent...day service could be better. Also, check your receipt. We were charged for wine by-the-glass when we actually bought the bottles. The Tapas are not as small as i'm used to. We got 3 and had plenty of leftovers (2 people).  They also have a market with Russian, Bulgarian & Spanish goodies like meats, cheeses, and Pantry items.

Saw this on DDD.  Wow!!! This place is amazing.  Great food, great atmosphere, great price!!!  Quite possibly my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  Take a look at their specials as they were quite delicious, decent portions for tapas like portions, and excellent price.  Their Georgian wine was fantastic.  I hope this place stays around for a while.  I am certainly going everytime I comeback to Vegas.

I had never been to Forte before but sure wished I had.  The food was so fresh that you could taste it the moment it touched your mouth We were unable to understand the menu but our server was so gracious and explained every dish in detail.  I can't begin to explain any of them, but I don't think you can go wrong.  I had the chicken with rice and fresh sliced tomatoes and it was marvelous.  As you can see I'm no food critic but it is worth the trip for this extraordinary faire.  I'll be back soon for sure.

We are regulars here, never will you come and be disappointed. It feels great to always be recognized and appreciated the moment you walk in through the door. We never wait for service and always have a great time. The shopska salad is to die for, we drive all the way from Boulder city to come here
Thank you DDD for introducing me to this place! I have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. THE BEST!

This food took me back to my trips to Bulgaria, Ukraine and Macedonia....  it was all so flavorful and the service was attentive and friendly.  We ordered a fair amount and discovered how great the prices were during happy hour, so we were very pleased!  Good dumplings, feta fries, chorizo and eggplant/red pepper dip.  Will definitely go again.
We had stuffed grape leaves, mixed grill, chorizo in red wine, stroganoff, and the fried dough in honey--all delish!!
Amazing food! Must check out! Service is excellent and try the shopska salad,

Awesome food, cool environment, great staff!! This place became one of my 3 go to places recently. The food tasted so fresh and definitely had a "home made" taste. I dont think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. Staff was very attentive and helpful with the menu and had great recommendations. End it with the biscuit cake (i think thats what it was called)....amazing!! Nothing else to say other than go there, great experience.

I really liked this place.  It felt like we were in Eastern Europe.  The only thing missing was a hint of Drakkar Noir in the air.

We had the following items:
---  Cheese plate:  Four cheeses paired with pureed fruit and nuts.  
---  Mixed olive plate - just OK, got to be a bit much
---  Chorizo con vino - this was my favorite
---  Vareniki - dumplings - also very good

The service was quite good and I really loved the atmosphere.  There are a lot more items on the menu I'd like to try.

Give Forte a try if you want to have a unique (for Las Vegas) dining experience.

The gf and I finally hit Forte - it's relatively close to our house ( about 2 miles ) but just now made it to the top of the "new try" list.

Went on a Tuesday night and the place had a decent crowd.  Quirky looking place and kinda strange lay-out of the tables but ok by us.  Servers were pleasant and attentive.  The gf was really focused on one of the servers hair style, " Should I get my hair like that?"  - must have asked me 4 times, hey !  I'm here to eat, not look at hair !

We avoided liquor since it was a weekday.  They provided a mini-loave of bread with olive oil and they recommended you add a special Bulgarian seasoning mix to the oil - the gf loved it - I also liked it though I felt she added to much of the herb mixture to the oil.

We ordered:

Beef Stroganoff Ragu ( $8 ) - Holy cow, the ragu was perfect !  the pasta shells were like little cups to hold the ragu - also very good but we wish they gave us more !

Chebureki ( $3.50 ) -two beef filled fried dumplings - basically a turnover.  perfectly fried, nice flaky crust, a little light on filling but what do you want for $3.50 ??

Bulgarian Mixed grill ( $10 ) - pork grilled three ways - two are sausage, one a patty.  Different seasoning and texture on all three .  came with a side of white beans and a salad similar to cole slaw but better - overall, an excellent plate of food !

Stuffed grape leaves( $5) - each one had a sausage in it.  I enjoyed but the gf prefers the middle eastern version that includes rice.

I wanted to avoid the sweets but I was being hounded so we ordered the rice pudding( I believe $4 ) and the biscuit cake ( $5).  The biscuit cake was very good - reminded us of tiramisu but the liquor flavor is lighter.  I'm not a rice pudding fan but I liked the generous amount of cinnamon on top of the pudding that gave it a nice kick.

a few pics attached

we'll definitely return

Usually associate Tapas Bar for Spanish cuisine, so decided to try to Forte on there version for European flare. After sampling Mixed Spanish Olives, Garlic Truffle Fries, Adjarski Khachapurri Siberian Mixed Grill plate, Thracian Clay Pot.  And for dessert had Baklava (Georgian Style) and Tirimasu (Georgian Style).

Food was very flavorful and the decor/atmosphere....definitively deserves a second visit.
Love this unique place and the inspiration of cultural diversity. even the decor transports your away from any notion of the strip being in this town.

As bulgarian I am really picky when it comes to bulgarian food. I ve tried popular bulgarian restourants in Chicago, DC and Atlanta, but Forte takes the authentic bulgarian kitchen to a different level. Great drinks as well. And the sevice is just top class!!! Natalia is simply phenomenal....!!! Good job guys!!

What an amazing spot! Natalia, our server was incredible, and the food superb. Great Sangria and a nice atmosphere!! In the shopping center at Flamingo/Rainbow..pretty centrally located for those of us in the Southwest part of town.

We wanted to try this place because if Guy Firie.
We had squid over rice, lamb lollipop, beef goulash and biscuit cake. 

The squid was kind of fishy not fresh. Hubby didn't like his lamb. The portion was very small  2 small prices of lamb and load of French fries. He asked for ketchup but they didn't have it. So the server asked if he wanna try Bulgarian red sauce without informing that she would charge $1 for a tiny sauce. 
My beef goulash was good but too salty. 
The biscuit cake was probably the best among these dishes. It was similar to tiramisu. I prefer tiramisu.

My husband and I wanted  To try something different that was not too far from our home. Forte did not disappoint! I had one on the Charcuterie boards and it was delicious. My husband had a lamb dish that was recommended and he loved it! My husband is a very tough critic! I try a new beer recommended by the bartender, it was delicious as well. Over all vibe is pretty cool, it's a tiny place so you have to make a reservation which we didn't know because this was our 1st timw so we sat at the bar. The staff is very friendly and helpful too! I totally recommend Forte!

I heard good things about this place and they were true.  Cool ambience (if you don't mind some old school propaganda) and all the food I had was very tasty.  Good, authentic Eastern European tapas and some of your normal Spanish style tapas fare.  Fair prices.  Highly recommended.

I finally decided to try Forte because I had seen it years ago on Diners, Drive ins and Dives. 

The restaurant is really cozy and unique! The food was tasty! I tried the clay pot and the mixed grill plate, which were both featured on triple d. The clay pot was different than anything I've ever tried before, and I would definitely recommend trying it! The mixed grill plate was very good too! There was a red sauce on the plate plus onions and cabbage, which all paired nicely with the sausages.

The two other items I tried that were amazing were he Russian meat dumplings (life changing-ly delicious) and the feta cheese phyllo dough pastry was so delicious! 

If you're looking to try something new, I definitely recommend this restaurant! Great service too!

Went to Forte again and had A GREAT MEAL AGAIN. Started with dates stuffed with almonds wrapped in bacon, on to lentil soup, to a mixed grill of Bulgarian sausage to fried pork dumplings and my wife and I loved the food, the great service and to European drinks. So if you are visiting Vegas and don't want to get stiffed buy the overpriced manufacture food for to Fortes just a few miles outside of the strip, thanks Nina again for a great meal!

I first came here with some business colleagues for a quick bite to eat. I can't say enough good things about this place! 

The food consists of Bulgarian and Russian inspired dishes. Portions are average size and I'd suggest ordering a few things to share with your party. I recommend the bacon wrapped dates and the grape leaves. You'll definitely find foods that are very unique compared to other usual fare. Every item I have tried is delicious and seasoned well. They even have a secret spice blend to put in your olive oil for bread dipping.

The place is small inside with half being dining and half is a marketplace. But it's a pleasant ambience.

The service was super friendly and the servers are happy to answer any questions about the menu. They are always perfectly attentive and the kitchen serves up food fresh and quickly. 

I highly recommend this place especially if you're looking for something a little different to try eating!

Utterly delicious. Had the chorizo con vino, almond stuffed dates,  herring and potatoes, jamon Serrano y Quezo, a few of the different dumplings, stuffed squid in its ink, stuffed grape leaves, these had a dill yogurt that I finished with the hot crusty bread, mixed spanish olives, and finished with a deliciously flaky baklava. Great place to hang out with friends and enjoy the food. Try the infused vodkas in the strange jars. Try the gypsy juice!

A bit divey but very cool
Felt like I was in Europe in a good way. They have a market with products I have never seen anywhere else. The meat and cheese selection is second to none. One of a kind :)
Yes!!! Such a great place. Nice to eat off the Vegas strip and get away from all the craziness. New place to always come to when I visit Las Vegas.

Very nice setting I had the lamb special everything was fresh and delicious I had some kind of a fresh watermelon drink that was absolutely delicious. The very lovely Mimi popped out I finished with some vodka drinks out on the patio had a great night I highly recommend this restaurant to anybody you won't find food like this anywhere in Vegas it is very good people
I make a point to come here when I am in Vegas.  One of the most unique places to eat and the food is always amazing. Be adventures and enjoy one of the best tapas places in the west coast.

If your looking for a great European drinks and food this place is for you! I give it five stars.  Great atmosphere with a great staff.  The staff was very knowledgeable and friendly! Blanca was an awesome server she answered all my questions and was very prompt I recommend asking for her! P. S. You have to try the biscuit cake! My all time favorite dessert!

What a cool place!! We loved it!! Our waitress was amazing and the food was even better. Super authentic and lots of flavor in every dish. And the biscuit cake for dessert is to die for! I will definitely be coming back!

On a recent visit to Forte, it seemed like the staff was in way over their heads. Since this was my only experience here, I will give them a little bit of slack. The food we had was all solid. I cannot say the same about the drink menu. With there being a large jump in price from the house wine to the next selection, I opted for the house red. It tasted like Kool-Aid. I would have tried a second glass, but the aforementioned service prevented that from going down. The specialty drinks on the menu all looked like they would rot your teeth. Unfortunately, throwing sugary ingredients into a cocktail glass is a common trend these days, and Forte is no different. The atmosphere is charming and cozy. I may try Forte again and hope that the staff is less chaotic.

Chill atmosphere, good service, and friendly staff. The food was "ok" and a bit overpriced for the flavor provided.  The drinks were good but skimpy on the portion. I will most likely will not return.

I walked in and was immediately dazed at how they decorated the place. Has a very authentic feel. Staff was very friendly. Food was AMAZING. My only regret is that I didn't order enough and we got here an hour before they closed.  I'll be back!

Wow! This place was amazing! Just got back from a European vacation and hard to adjust. I go back to work next week and I needed something to keep me where I've been. From the moment I walked in I felt like I was back in Europe. The music, the art, the culinary expertise and the friendly staff! Thank you Kristiyana for mixing up the best cocktails (Forte Mojito, Forte Jackass, Gypsy Milk. To the cooks we never get to see...the dates, Easter lamb, Thracian clay pot and biscuit...scrumptious! Thank you

The Vareniki is a MUST for all you vegeterians. And for those with a sweet tooth, the Biscuit Cake was not big enough to satisfy me after the first bite of heavenly desserts! My BF loved the Thracian clay pot for you meat eaters and the Hungarian goulash This place is must!
If you like Bulgarian food with nice smooth vine then this place is for you guys!!! It is going to cost you around 30 dollars for good lunch!

I heard this place was small so I was nervous they were not going to be able to accommodate my party of 10 on Sunday night. Luckily, everything worked out perfectly as they seated us at their large family table with benches. I think there was only one other table of customers so we basically had the restaurant to ourselves! Sunday nights must not be a big night for them but we didn't mind.

Regardless, this place is really funky inside. The artwork on the walls, the music, and the vibe offers a fun and offbeat experience. They have a fairly extensive selection of beers, wine, and cocktails. I had the Angry Ginger cocktail which was basically ginger infused vodka in lemonade with muddled mint. It was like a mojito lemonade, but with a ginger kick. Delicious!

We shared two orders of the Georgian bread for the table. This is their famous boat bread with the egg and the cheese in the middle. It was a huge hit! It takes a little longer because it's baked fresh right then and there but once it hit the table, everyone dove in. 

The menu is kind of funky so with a party of ten, we just jumped in and ordered a ton of items. We ordered a few Spanish tapas for the table, then a few entrees to share. Some people ordered soups and salads, etc. Overall, I think we did it the perfect way. There wasn't a morsel of food left over and everyone left satisfied. Not one person was unhappy with the food. It was truly delicious and fresh. They are really doing it right in that kitchen!

I had to order the clay plot specialty after having read all about it on yelp and seeing it on Triple D. Once it arrived, I was surprised - it was really not anything special. I thought it was going to blow me away but almost every other entree was much more of a delight. I would skip it next time. 

Highlights were: Georgian bread, Beef Strogenoff, Pelmeni, Mixed Grill plate.

The food had a Miriad of ethnic sensations which delighted my pallet. The curb appeal sucks! You really need to enter and take a seat and order. Once inside the decor is entertaining but the place kinda smells funky, like a butcher shop. But once you look at the menu and order, all that is behind you and pleasure awaits. Cuz the food is really good. I had great service as well. I would have given it more stars if the curb appeal wasn't so discouraging.

This is a hidden gem inside the Spring Valley Town Center shopping plaza. It has Eastern European (e.g., Bulgaria, Serbia, Russia) food. Some items come as tapas and others are large enough to be considered a meal. I usually get several items. I enjoy the restaurant dcor, food, service, and entertainment. At night they have a piano player. The restaurant is colorful and comfortable.

My favorite soup is the Borscht (beet soup) and my favorite seasonal salad is the Forte Fetamelon Salad. The soup is served hot and has beets, cabbage, potatoes, and a dollop of sour cream. It is absolutely great! The Fetamelon Salad has freshly cut watermelon, red onion, mint leaves, and Bulgarian feta. I actually look forward to summer to enjoy this salad.

The Bulgarian Easter Lamb is amazing. The lamb is tender and the portion is satisfying. It is served with a small salad and mashed potatoes. I usually get this with the Thracian Clay Pot, which is a small hot pot that is backed with egg, tomatoes, peppers, sausage, and feta. It sounds strange, but it is definitely a must try. This item often takes 20 minutes to bake.
 
My favorite mixed grill is the Bulgarian one. It has a great selection of Bulgarian meats and I love the various bean, relish & slaws as they go great with the meat. Just don't think you can order extra of the slaws - They are served only with the mixed grill and you cannot obtain a side order. 

The ice-tea is freshly brewed. The water is served out of old Vodka bottles. They have great tableside herbs that I used to love putting on the bread they serve prior to your meal. I am not a fan of the recent change in the bread they are using. It is not as good as what they used to have a year ago. Maybe they can change it back!?

Try their version of tiramisu cake. It is truly a treat!

We really enjoyed our fun meal at this unique establishment. The art work on the menus and the walls is a striking style for sure. I won't try to describe it here. The dishes were all handmade pottery direct from Bulgaria! Amazing designs! Perhaps most importantly, our server, Nataliya, was delightful as she described the available dishes and drinks. 

We started with Bulgarian liquor called Rakija. This clear drink certainly had a kick and was a great apritif! We then moved on to the main courses. The prices were quite reasonable. For example, my Bulgarian mixed grill with three kinds of sausages was $11. In fact, we ordered three main courses so we could try the Thracian Clay Pot which we found intriguing. It's some tasty comfort food with a strong flavor profile and one hell-hot pepper hiding in the pot. Be careful!

Make sure you ask for their homemade bread. With olive oil and an incredible spice mix already on the table to mix in the oil and then use to dip the bread, it's a taste sensation.

I can't finish this review without mentioning the soundtrack playing over the speakers. It was an awesome deep house mix. When we unsuccessfully tried to identify it with Shazam, Nataliya informed us they are mixes from DJ Mascota from Sofia, Bulgaria! Bulgarian electronic dance music with Bulgarian liquor and food! We've since found DJ Mascota's music on SoundCloud and it does not disappoint! I think we'll have to head to Sofia to check out the music scene!

I recently stopped in to check the place out. I first tried them out at life Is Beautiful Festival, they had a booth set up. It awesome so I decide to go back.

They have food from all over tapas style. European, Spanish, Bulgarian, Russian and Georgian. I honestly wanted to try them all but I settled for 3 and a Moscow mule.

I ordered the Chebureki, pelimen and something I'll never be able to spell correctly but was essentially a cross between a pide and egg in a boat. They were so good. I joined the empty plate club no problem.

The best part I got it all for under $30. They have happy hour specials too every night. Two thumbs up, definitely going back and bringing friends. It gets my first and only 5 star rating. 

Now drool at the pics of my food.

I've been here several times and have also taken out of state friends here and the food is always delicious! The European atmosphere also adds to the experience :) The service has gotten better over time. Initially it seemed like they were somewhat understaffed and it's great that the management took care of that issue. Will definitely be back soon :)
There is no option for no stars or I would give them nothing, horrible service and very long wait to have a server come and greet us and take our order. Refuse to ever go again.  0/5 rating overall.

While searching on Yelp* for our weekly "food adventure" with my girlfriend, we came across Forte mainly because the Spain/Bulgaria description intrigued us!  

Located in a strip mall, Forte Tapas R & B has an unassuming exterior but boasts a mixture of Spanish/Eastern European kitsch that's not offensive to the eyes.  It offers indoor and outdoor seating but during our visit we opted for indoor to take in the ambiance of the decor.  (We would've sat outside  but during our visit, there was a food truck gathering that was blaring out really bad hip hop music.  That and the temperature was a million degrees that August 25th evening!)

We were seated promptly and our waitress take our drink order.  My girlfriend and I shared the Bulgarian beer called "Zagorka", which was  light and clean tasting with no lingering aftertaste.

We order the standard Almond Stuffed Dates, which was tasty.  Unless you are incompetent, you really can't screw up this easy dish!  My girlfriend orders the Lentil Soup, which she found to be very flavorful and earthy as lentils are by nature.  She also orders the Beef Stroganoff Ragu to round out her meal, which was very light and not overly cloying and rich as cream based meals tend to be.  

I ordered the Stuffed Baby Squid in Ink over Spanish Herbed Rice (Calamares Rellenos en su Tinta) for myself.  After watching "Bizzare Foods" I was always on the hunt for a restaurant that served mollusks marinated in its own ink.  All I can say is, "Wow!"  Do yourselves a favor, gentle readers and try this dish!  You may thank me later!  I also order the Chorizo simmered in Red Wine (Chorizo con Vino), which was good but left a somewhat oily aftertaste.  

Service was very attentive and knowledgeable when asked about the menu and establishment.  Our water glasses were never empty and the wait staff were quick and prompt and also took the time to chat with us, asking us how we liked the food.

I highly recommend this restaurant, especially when our bill came out to less than $55, minus the tip.  This place is a great alternative to FireFly if one finds that venue to be too crowded and loud.

Eastern European food, live music, and crazy cocktails- what more do you need in life?
Since my last visit, menu has changed and service is more cohesive with both more employees and a hot black-and-white striped dress as a uniform. I dig it!

THRACIAN CLAY POT: A must-order, featured on the Triple D special. Similar to an Israeli shakshuka dish, the flavors of tomato, egg, and peppers mix well. "Unlike anything I've ever had before," according to a well-traveled friend of ours.

STROGANOFF FRIES: The stroganoff ragu they do so well here is now used in a European version of chili fries, and to great success. These are addictive!

SOLYANKA: traditional Russian soup with lemon and smoked meats, super tasty. Best version of this soup that I've had anywhere, and that's saying something.

SOFIISKA BANIZA: Rolls of filo dough stuffed with feta cheese and served with sour cream, even more delicious than burekas, it's a calorie bomb but so damn worth it.

Service is attentive, drinks are strong (Jackass, Mint Ginger Lemonade, and Sangria are all solid options), and the music is live- great place to catch up with friends and share a ton of food you won't find anywhere else in Vegas.

Tried this place last night at a friends recommendation. I was pleasantly surprised upon arrival and ended up having a really lovely evening. Four of us shared numerous dishes/tapas. A few of our favorites included the fetamelon salad (um best feta I've ever had), the beef stroganoff, the lamb lollipops, and the veriniki (sp?). The staff was attentive yet didn't linger and always sweet even humorous at times. Add in some live music to top it all off and our return is guaranteed. This place reminds me of something you would find in NYC on every block. But there's only one...in a strip mall. I'll take it.

Very comforting yet different foods.  I went with a friend and had a daily special.  Egg, meat and potatoes were baked and paired with tomatoes in oil.  I had the Uzbekistan rice as well.  My friend got the grilled meats.  Everything tasted fantastic.  The meats were cooked perfectly, not dry like other places.  My dish was very homey.  I also loved the atmosphere, just as the chalkboard wall with Guy Fieri's signature.  Very cool place.
DDD was right on point with this place. Great service and atmosphere. Food was really good as well. Tried the Thracian pot and it was just like on TV . I think I'll try this place again soon

Forte is one of our fave Eastern European dining spots. Plunk right in the middle of an unassuming Bonito/Lee's strip mall, this mostly Bulgarian staffed deli/dinnery (yes I just made up a word), is easy to miss as you drive by on Rainbow Bl.

The decor is shabby-chic with a mish-mash of furniture, wall hangings, flooring and just plain random stuff everywhere. It works.

The food: ahhhh, the food. I had "Bulgarian Easter Lamb" (pic). Braised lamb chunks pressed into a tuna-can shaped mold. Accompanied by arugula mashed potatoes, a yummy and very creative spring salad and some rich reduction au jus.

I also had hot borscht (beef based with spud cubes, carrots and of course cabbage ... very savory). Now keep in mind this is not the Russian/Jewish style borscht with sugar, raisins and that distinctive sour salt tang. But oh so hearty and quite grounding.

My consort dined on Shopska (pic), a chopped salad with rustic-cut Persian cukes, tomatoes, green onions and canned Ortega chillis ... all tossed in a subtle herb vinaigrette. She also had a thick and tasty lentil soup, and a rich filo dough roll the size of a danish filled with Russian feta cheese.

The last pic is my Russian vodke  It comes in a mini Russian oil can. Quite smooth. It's called "Neft", which means motor oil 

If you find yourself on the West side, please check Forte out! 5-stars all the way. Oh, and our server was bubbly and fun ... yay!

If you are staying on a LV strip your cab ride will be around $30 one way. If you know what the Russian food should taste like than you will be greatly dissapointed after visiting this place. My husband and I came here craving some Russian Solyanka soup and Pelmeni... ended up being nothing close to the real taste at all... this place didn't worth a $60 cab ride.

What a dump,It looks like a 50's coffee house,the food I had was the worst I've had in Vegas,the Bulgarian mixed grill tasted as if it was made a week ago,the meat was so tough it took quite some effort to cut it and no flavor,the grape leaves were mushy and very tough not a place I'd visit again.

Just went here for lunch.  SLLOOOW but friendly service, my feeling is they keep a very bare bones staff, at least for lunch that is. Nina herself seated us, ask if we wanted water but never got it.  While does the restaurant just opened at noon, I noticed that not one of the 8 people seated when we got there  had any food or drinks and it was 12:30 pm when we arrived.   It basically took about 10 minutes for the waiter to ask us if we wanted anything to drink, and another 10 to bring us the drinks.  We realized that since we were hungry we better order our food with our drinks. 

We ordered:
Sofiiska baniza- My husband order this, which is filo with cheese...looks lovely, but it didn't look like light layery filo though, more like a bit too doughy.  My husband said it was dense and just "fine". (I don't eat starches.) 

Octopus over rice from the tapas menu.  The octopus was fishy for me, but the rice was nicely cooked, according to my husband. 

Mixed grill- It was very good, one of the sausage links was cooked way more than I like, almost dry, but maybe that is the way it is suppose to be.  Still tasty. The patty seasoning was assertive, but not overpowering.  I liked the red pepper condiment and the onions marinated with mint that come with the mixed grill, it also comes with beans which we didn't eat, but looked appealing.   It really is a good portion size, especially for the price.

Thoracian Clay pot- By this time, we were pretty full, but we loved this and ate it all, but  it reminded me of a great breakfast dish that could easily be made at home, because the little clay pot had sauteed tomato, onions, bell peppers, feta, a few slices of charcuterie, and what probably should be a baked egg with an oozy yolk, but our yolk was cooked through. Still it was delicious. However, that little tasty claypot maybe way too small of a portion to satisfy a very hungry person if this is all one orders.  

You can tell almost everyone in the restaurant that this was their first time.  I guess inspired by DDD.  Yes, sadly and quite embarrassingly, I saw it too and wanted to go.  While I am not above them, I think the "foodie" want-a-bes were pretty annoying...one actually playing the DDD episode on his phone, and two old but very plump ladies asking annoying (stupid) questions to the waiter about the owner and trying to get EXACTLY same menu as on that episode of DDD...as if it was a tasting menu.  

Cool environment though, better if I just want to hang out, relax and have a few drinks at a VEEERRY leisurely pace.  I am glad I gave it a try, but probably won't go back, definitely not for lunch.  

My advice: definitely try this place out, but don't go here for a "quick" lunch on your lunch hour.

My favorite European restaurant in town.  Discovered by our friends who are foodies. So far we've been there twice and both times we were very happy with the service and food. The second time, about a month ago, the restaurant had an addition - a small area where you can buy all kinds of European products like pickles, cheese,  liquor etc.

I have been searching for European food & I've finally found this place which hit the spot! I miss my moms & grandmas cooking so much & this is the closest I can find in Vegas! The staff is so friendly & the atmosphere is very unique, felt like I was back home & I loved it!
The food is great & I can't wait back to explore the menu! They even have European dumplings just like my moms pierogi & that nostalgic taste makes me so very happy!
I cannot wait to go back!
Had lunch here and was really impressed we have this place here in Vegas. Great ambiance and great service. Server Elsa gave great suggestions and the food was delicious.

Great experience! From tasty food to friendly service - everything was superb from such and unassuming place on the outside. Flavor infused vodka was amazing followed by best lamb chops i had anywhere! Chebureki were very juicy and done just right. Goulash is tender and flavorful. This is the place to check out if you love eastern European food or even if you are just curious. We will definitely be back to try everything on the menu.
Really cool little European infused restaurant and bar. A rare gem in LV. Decor is so fun, gypsy juice is delicious, and a great environment for small and large parties alike.

If you watch DD&D, it is as good as Guy says! The clay pot was amazing! Loved the stroganoff fries. The chicken soup had a light soft broth with chunks of chicken, carrots and potatoes. Everything we ordered was a huge hit!!

I give four stars for the Thracian Clay Pot. YUM!!! My friend told me to order it, and I did, although it isn't something I'd usually order. It is SO GOOD, and occasionally I get a craving for that exact flavor in my mouth. Everything else was very good - I don't remember eating anything that I didn't like! I recommend this place to those looking for something different than their usual. It isn't somewhere I'd go all the time and call a staple, but I definitely see myself going 2-3 times a year. In fact - I can't wait to go back and have some more of that pot!!!

We saw this place on Diners Drive-ins and Dives so we had to try it. 1 word... Outstanding! Fantastic food and excellent service. I had the Thracian clay pot and it did not disappoint! It was delicious :))

Saw this place on "Dinners, Drive-Ins and Dives" a couple of weeks before my trip to Las Vegas - decided to go for lunch.  Food was good, service was fine (was only a handful of people there on a Friday for lunch).  The Solyanka soup was AWESOME.

I wish I could give a higher review but my dinning experience just was not very good. I love this kind of food but the entire experience was way off. The chicken soup was tasteless, the chorizo was not very spicy and the sauce was like warmed red wine. None of the hot dishes ordered were hot, and several were way salty. The staff were like zombies, they were nice but going through the motions. It really felt like we picked an off night. I will try again as I always like to give a place a fair chance but I will not run back. Oh quick note ... I am not a big sangria fan but they served a vey tasty Sangria and a very tasty mojito.

The food is absolutely delicious  I love it it's different than any regular American restaurant but so good.
After I taste it the plates finished very fast. You me of the best places in this area. Very very recommended. Good service people very nice and friendly but the most important is the food . Amazing and delicious

In Vegas...this is a good as it gets for great food at AMAZING PRICES. Let me stick with the value comment here....Literally, nothing costs more than $10. If you're tired of the usual hotel eateries and yes there are hundreds of absolutely amazing places in LV, try Forte. I found this place, er should I say my husband found it watching diners drive in's and dives (a show I can't watch but he LOVES) - Paul and I have been to a few of the show's recommendations in L.A. and they weren't bad so I was not adverse to the suggestion of having lunch away from the usual confines of the strip hotels, plus I was excited to bring my girlfriend Zana, who recently moved to town, to a place that served some menu items from her homeland of Serbia. 

We arrive at the restaurant in a fairly large but unassuming strip mall, and walk into the just the cutest place ever. Art on the walls, deep rich colors and a huge beautiful bar and a small cozy dining room. For lunchtime on a holiday week it was crowded enough so that my party of 6 had to wait a few minutes for a table large enough to seat us opened up. The owner was so sweet and nice offering my pre-teen nieces flavored sodas from Spain while we waited and sipped our wine.

Serbian Hamburger....don't knock the name. It was the best thing I had there among amazing stuffed grape leaves, grilled meats, rich chickpea soup and the lamb and beef confit over rice was almost like a jumbalaya. Other good picks are the pan con tomate and this dish that comes in a super hot individual pot that has beef/sausage, tomatos, onions, spices, an amazing broth, cheese and an egg for good measure. It's apparently an very old dish dating back to ancient Greece.

I am soooo going back for dinner next time and will take a taxi and leave the kids so we can take our time and enjoy the wine.

Horrible service and experience. After being ignored for thirty minutes I had to tackle down a waitress. This waitress (short blonde hair) didn't write down our order therefore they  would walk table to table with plates of food asking if it was our order. 30 minutes later we finally got out clay pot and it tasted gross as if it sat out for 2 days. We asked for our bill since the other half of our order wasn't ready. So we left and went to Bachi Burger.

With  no experience at all withEastern European food, we approached this with some trepidation.  Are we glad that we decided to give this culinary adventure a whirl...this was simply marvelous!  We had the stuffed dates in bacon and the stroganoff fries...both were amazing.  The fried (Georgian) dumplings were perfectly crispy, and the Russian potato/onion dumplings delicious with the sour cream.  Bulgarian grill was very well balanced with the sweet onion relish...wow!  We'll be back!
3.5 the food was very fresh and delicious. It's great to have something other than your ordinary American restaurant food. Ambience and decor was fun. The smell was a little "off." Will return

My husband and I went on Friday night.  He had the Angry Ginger Lemonade which was wonderful. I had the Sour Bulgarian which was just ok. When we walked in there was a chalkboard of specials and I noticed stuffed cabbage which is one of my favorites so we ordered that along with the lamb and beef confit and the beef stroganoff.  The cabbage was excellent but the other dishes we just ok. A lot of salt was used.  I would go back to give it another whirl just because I liked the atmosphere and it is a triple D.
Moment I walked in the door I knew it was going to be wicked good! Watermelon salad was refreshing and lite. Stuffed peppers were great! The bread, oil and seasoning were a wonderful touch.

Love this place!! The food is always amazing and so fresh every time I get something. My favorite dish here so far has to be the Easter lamb! I do recommend calling in if you do order takeout only because sometimes orders do not go thru on yelp. The atmosphere is so friendly and nice  having this place so close to home makes it all the better!! Especially after working a long day and not wanting to cook but still wanting a homemade type of meal. Highly recommend!!

Try this one , Bulgarian deal was scared but don't be . Great  new seasonings for me. Chicken soup A+ , Cured truffle meats, Good real good. Salads excellent. Nice to find something new, different & simple. Enjoy.

... Such a great night!!

- Live music at 7pm on Fri & Sat.   He has a great voice and sounds great singing lots of favorites and classics

- Great wine and cocktail list- yummy & refreshing sangria and gypsy milk!

- Best Cabbage Rolls ever

- loved the spice in the olive oil for bread. 

- lots of culture & character in this strip mall restaurant

- only 70.00 for 2 and we ate and drank alot!!

- wonderful service .... by all .... many are from eastern europe !

Enjoy Forte! ...  :-)
Best European food in town by far. Anyone can like the food here and try the octopus rice or their famous clay pot. Highly recommended.

Finally tried this place after seeing it on Triple D several times. We tried the clay pot, stuffed grape leaves and the sausage plate that Guy also sampled . This place is great! Prices were reasonable too. We've tried about a half dozen of the Triple D recommendations and this place was the best. We're going to get some sausage and smoked fish right before we go back to Orange county. When we come back to Vegas were hitting this place again.

First time trying out a Bulgarian cuisine. The place is not very big, but the food and service was amazing. My fiance ordered their salad (forgot the name), and I had some shrimp and soup called borscht. They serve small portions but every dog we had was flavorful. I would go again if I'm in the area.

Went here with my boyfriend and we were super excited considering it is right down the street from us and we have been wanting to try it out for a while now. I saw forte on food network and knew that it would be a great spot. I got the Thoracian clay pot and when I read the description, I thought I knew what to expect, but I was wrong! I thought the dish was a lot more simple than what it actually tastes like. It took me for a surprise and a good one at that. It is packed with flavor! My boyfriend and I also shared the adjarski khachapurri which was so delicious. I highly recommend it. He got the Bulgarian Easter lamb which was super juicy, tender and it just melts in your mouth. It kind of reminded me of oxtail because of how tender it was. I gave them 4 stars and I would have done 5, but my only complaint is the portion because I was still a little hungry when I had left lol.

This is the first of a handful of reviews that fall under the "HOLY CRAP, WHY HAVEN'T I BEEN HERE SOONER" category. 

When I first moved here, I flagged Forte on my list of places I'd like to try because it was featured in an article featuring great lunches under $10. 

Flash forward five years later...

Yes, five years.

Yes, I know that's a long time. 

Yes, I'm kicking myself. 

To my credit, I went back a week later. Twice in two weeks. So there. 

Anyway, despite being it the same plaza as La Bonita Market, it's situated far enough away to allow for easy parking. 

Reservations can be made. I'm not sure if they're needed since both of my visits to date were rather early in the evening. In any case, should you arrive and find yourself waiting for a table, the waiting area rolls into a market and small bar.
