Seating is comfortable. There are mostly 4-tops in the uniquely decorated dining room. To no one's surprise, the walls are covered with Spanish and Eastern European decor. 

The menu provides a wide range of selections; I can't imagine there wouldn't be something for everyone here. All of the items were well prepared and, while I enjoyed some items more than others, there wasn't anything I truly disliked. 

Notable items: 

- Ajarski Khachapuri. Two kinds of cheese oven-baked into a crusty loaf with an egg stirred in upon its arrival to one's table. There is absolutely nothing wrong with this, unless you have celiac disease, are lactose-intolerant (or both), or hate the little things in life that make people happy. It's worth a trip here for this alone, paired with beers or a few ice-cold adult beverages.  

- Octopus in olive oil. Can't go wrong when all of the components are of good quality.

- Stroganoff fries. This is more of a notable item because of its novelty. If it hurts your heart too much, you can order fries and stroganoff as separate dishes. But, come on, live a little, friends. 

- Biscuit cake. Do I really need to attempt a compelling argument for dessert?

- KBG martini. Pickled martini. With the Khachapuri. Just yes. 

There is happy hour 5pm - 7pm, Paella on Saturdays, and a brunch menu I assume on weekends.

I'll definitely be back and it won't take five years...
Clay pot not all I was expecting. But it's worth to try it this place at least once. It's more like russian food such as borscht..
It was Interesting... and decent... but I should of saved my money... I watched Guy give this place raves on TV... I am not sure it's all that... but over all interesting food that was good. :-)

In the last 3 years, we have enjoyed going here several times. Tonight, we saw them highlighted on a Guy Fiero Triple D rerun. It reminded us to go again. As always, the atmosphere, food and service was excellent. Guy actually showed up and treated us all in the restaurant with vodka shots. The best part was Natalya. We have been there when she was not, and still enjoyed it. When she is there, it is even better. She was our first server and our favorite.  Now, we will go Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays because those are the nights she works. Cute, friendly, and so nice!
Saw this bistro on Diners, drive-ins and dives the food was great we had the meat platter mix grill and the chicken shish kabob I would go back for sure

Forte has an incredibly extensive menu that ranges from Spanish tapas to Russian and Bulgarian specialties, but I'll get to the food later because the MOST UNIQUE part of this restaurant are the numerous house Infused Vodkas:

 The "Garden Vodka" when used as a substitute for every ingredient in your Dirty Martini excluding dry vermouth, creates an Exceptionally tasty yet one of a kind Cocktail. And I'm not afraid to admit that I am definitely a cocktail snob ;D

There is raspberry infused vodka, potato infused vodka, various Grappas... The list goes on- you need to check this place out if only to discover the rest. In addition they have Banana Sambuca, and while it isn't infused in house it's definitely going to be a pleaser for adventurous types. The bar is very well stocked from recongnizable alchohol to imported beers and wine, and especially imported vodkas; So don't be afraid to get obscure, like small village in the Ukraine obscure.

Service- One thing I couldn't understand are the bad reviews preceding mine! You cannot come here expecting your service to be like The Olive Garden or some other heinous food chain. Forte is definitely an intimate atmosphere if you go early or on a weeknight. Thursday night is quietest. Because like most Eastern European bars/ casual restaurants they like to get a little rowdy with music! It's apart of the culture. They are having Jazz on Mondays though FYI. Service is personable and casual, and perfect for what it is.

The food is incredibly fresh and delicious. The egg boat had a name I won't even try to pronounce (see pictures), and is a dish I've never come across before. So happy I did! My favorites were the almond stuffed dates (Rich and Delightful) and the Feta Burek with its flaky delicate crust and creamy center- Mmmm. For dessert we had the biscuit cake which reminded us of Tiramisu at first glance, but had this incredibly soft texture and taste that did not resemble Tiramisu, and it was a sumptuous finish to a quite filling dinner. They have flavored cappuccinos as well! 

If I had to sum up this place in a sentence it would be:
Don't miss out!!

This was easily the best meal we had in Las Vegas last weekend!  The drinks were amazing - in presentation, flavor, and inventiveness!  The food was amazing as well - so delicious and fun to share.  The staff was really great - we loved the laid back vibe.  Very European and funky feel.  If I lived here I would eat here all the time!

We went to lunch here after seeing on DDD - with Guy Fieri.  WORTH IT!

We ordered stuffed baby bells, Dolma, Clay Pot and a Bulgarian Mixed Grill plate.  They also served fresh bread, we had olive poil and a spice mixture out of this world.

EVERYTHING was completely amazing. It was like being in my grandmothers kitchen as a young girl.  Every dish was so yummy.  

The sauce on the dolma and stuffed peppers complimented the flavors completely.  

The mixed grill including bean salad and onion/potato salad was spot on.  The pepper sauce was perfect.

At the end the clay pot came out - it takes 20 minutes to cook.  OH M GEE!   

The four dishes and two glasses of wine came to $60 - which is right what I expected to pay. 

The surprise here - besides the food really being as spectacular toted on TV - was they have a full deli and market featuring a lot of meats, olives, dates from Eastern Europe.

At first, I didn't think that this place was even open. It was located in a shopping center, but from the outside, appeared dark and shut down. I actually called just to make sure they were open.  They were, thankfully! The inside is..interesting! They've got twinkly lights hanging, music posters, and artwork. A musician was softly playing a variety of songs, mostly 80s and soft-rock hits. 

I started with the Ginger Lemonade, which I thought was great. Our server was nice enough, but didn't seem to know much about the menu.

The food was fine. I'm not super familiar with Eastern European food, and having eaten it, I don't think that it will be my favorite cuisine, but I'm glad that I had an opportunity to try it.  I enjoyed the bread stuffed with cheese and topped with egg (it really does cook in front of you!) as well as the potato dumplings. 

It is definitely an "off the beaten path" type of restaurant, and something different in Las Vegas. Worth a look if you're in the neighborhood and want to try European foods.

Eclectic little place. Dark and cozy. Not the best area of town. Unfamiliar with this kind of food and wanted to try something new. Had the beef stroganoff tapas. Tasty, a good starter. Then the Rosemary garlic flatbread with mortadella. Then we shared this roll that looked like a cinnamon roll but it was filled with feta and sour cream on the side. All of the breads were very good. I liked this last dish, but with so much feta it was really salty. We finished with their signature dessert, a biscuit with layers Of mascarpone and chocolate sauce. It wasn't bad. It could have used something to give it a little crunchiness and the chocolate was regular Hershey's chocolate syrup.  They had a crepe dessert option which I would try the next time.
What a great find!! Excellent variety of food and it all tasted amazing. Atmosphere was inviting and festive. Will definitely come back whenever I am in town.
Absolutely excellent food,creative menu and enough happy hour selections to have an entire meal!  What a gem stuck in a crappy strip mall.

Terrible service, and the food was just as bad. Description of the food was way off, and the amount they give you is below menial. I don't know why they never paid attention to us, but when they did, it sucked.

Been here a couple times. Both REALLY good. Both times I've been were during non peak times, like 3 or 4 PM. This is a very unique restaurant!! It's a bit dark inside and they have house/EDM playing in the background. The food is really fresh, flavorful, different. The dates wrapped in bacon, can't go wrong with that. The lamb is so moist and tender. Also enjoyed the octopus, which was served cooked. bread with spices and oil is really good. LOVED the watermelon salad I had last summer (in season only). The clay pot was okay, didn't see as good as I saw from T.V. (food network) Service has been good both times I've gone. They even hooked up my brother with birthday dessert. One of my new favorite spots. Thank you guys!

Went there for dinner recently with family. Found the place easily but we thought we had the wrong place initially. From the outside, the place was nothing special. If there weren't some tables or chairs on the sidewalk in front of it, I don't think we would have found the right place or door to enter. From outside it looks like a smoke shop or a convenience store. There are posters and all kinds of stuff on the windows, not something you would expect at a classier place or restaurant. Inside we were pleasantly surprised however. Place was nice and cozy and nice music. It was overall a nice atmosphere...more lounge like than restaurant like. I think they'll get a lot more business if the make the outside look presentable too. If I was just driving by and wanted to eat, I would have never stopped there bc from outside it looks like a 1 star place. Anyway, we sat to eat. We had a toddler with us but they have no high-chairs for kids. Please get some. There were others with little kids and babies and NO baby seats so parent had to hold all the kids. Good thing ours was old enough to sit in chair without falling. 

Service was great and fast. Waiters were nice and professional. Place was very clean. Our orders were taken quickly and the food started coming out fast. One thing we did not like was that some of us got our meals before we even got our drinks or salads or appetizers. Who does that? Waitress told us that she has to bring us the food as the chef makea it, but c'mon. But why would the chef make our main course before our salad and appetizers. I was already full before my appetizer, soup and salad came out. My family waited to get soup and salad before touching their meals, but by that time their main course meal was already cold. Food was ok. Nothing to write home about. It wasn't bad by any means but the fries were overcooked and hard and crispy and all the meats were very very dry. No juice on the meat at all. My wife and mother had the chicken soup. I didn't try but they said it was so bland that they each started adding whatever salt and spices we had on the table to give it flavor. My toddler loves soup but she didn't even want that one. It wasn't bad people, just  could be better...juicier, more flavor and served IN ORDER....... Drinks, appetizers, soup/salad, main course, dessert, etc. Overall we had a good experience. Place and staff are good. I would go again eventually. I do recommend you try for yourself and I hope owners take some pointers from this review.

Saw this on an episode of diners, drive-ins and dives and decided to try.  Phenomenal!!!  Everything was excellent . . . food, drinks, service, atmosphere, music . . . loved it all.  The bread and olive oil with the special blend of Bulgarian spices could have been a meal - amazing.  We had 10 or so items from the menu and all were fantastic.  Save room for the biscuit cake - so yummy!  Can't wait to go back!!

This is one of the best finds in las Vegas!   6 of us went to dinner and tried everything on the menu.   The only one we did not like was the pot of food with the egg.   It looked great but the combination was not there.   We would recommend this place everytime.   The second visit was as good as the first.   Very consistent!  Exceptional Food and presentation!

I had high hopes for this place based on the local press it has been getting.

Kind of funky interior, and definitely has a European feel to it

I spent some time with the menu and was a bit overwhelmed by all the dishes available

Finally ordered a few things, and while sitting at the bar ( keep in mind this is a non-gaming establishment )    I notice someone to my far left smoking and then after speaking with the waitress / bartender another guest starts smoking 2 seats down from me on the left.     I overhear the waitress / bartender say something to the effect of "Smoking is ok at the bar"

No actually its not OK,   you can't just make up you're own smoking policy.    Its disgusting and I refuse to eat anywhere that smoking is permitted - legally or otherwise

Before my food arrived I left

I will not be returning under any circumstances

Fantastic! Bulgarian food is always delicious but these cooks go above and beyond to bring back childhood memories. I left feeling so satisfied! On top of all this the service was impeccable. 
If you are looking for fast food go somewhere else because all the food was made fresh right after you order. Perfect for socializing with friends around big plates of delicious memories!

Everything on this menu is out of this world. Please get the biscuit cake - you won't be sorry! The ambience is great. There is a steady soundtrack of electro pop to get you grooving. It was on Diners Drive ins and Dives for a reason!

Coming to the forte for the first time since I moved to Vegas from Miami Florida and I feel like I have actually stepped out of town and into this relax social setting where I can really enjoy a good meal for the first time. 

Today I had a light meal including their famous gypsy milk cocktail which is ultimately refreshing especially for this Las Vegas heat made with a huckleberry vodka and a secret gypsy juice 

My meal today was a Thracian clay pot that was famously featured in one of my favorite shows drivers dine in dives. It is definitely something to look into. 

The staff here are super friendly especially Jose. He was super outgoing and gave me all my great recommendations this being my first time. I have worked all around in the restaurant business and I am very happy to say that after much exploring in this new city Forte is one of my favorite spots already. You must go check this place out

I'm shocked at the few bad reviews I see for this great place.  They mostly seem to be about the service and not the food.  My wife and I had a great experience and the food was fantastic.  My grandparents are Polish and Ukrainian, so I grew up eating some similar foods.  Similar but not the same.  The dishes have a different spice profile and are more delicate.  The food we had was delicious.  The borscht beat my grandmothers.  The pelmeni are tender and so tasty.  We had both the stroganoff and the plain with sour cream and dill.  We had the Thracian clay pot ... yummy.  We also had the Khachapurri which is a bread with a cheese and egg filling.  Also delicious.  They have a nice selection of vodkas, wines and beers too.  Our service was outstanding.  I think she was the owner, but she was friendly knowledgeable and very engaging.  

I highly recommend checking this place out in Las Vegas.  It was better than any meal we have had in the Bellagio I can tell you that.  The final bill of $45 including drinks beats most of prices on the strip as well.

Came here with another couple and ordered the Pelmeni, Vareniki, and Chebureki.  Of the them were pretty good.  We also ordered a meat platter that had a really good bean relish.  The Feta cheese fries were excellent also.  I would eat here again.

Loved the food!! I been dying to come ever since seeing it on Guy Fiere's *Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. Started off with appetizers the Bacon wrapped dates, Chorizo, and then the Bulgarian Easter lamb, Hungarian goulash over mashed potatoes and then the Thracian clay pot. I live in Hawaii so we made sure to try at least 2-3 dishes.
Took me 2 years but i finally got there!! It was well worth the wait.

Pleasant ambience. Delicious food. Lack of service. Concept is lacking personal approach and a tad pretentious. Server was clumsy enough to drop wine on my white trousers. She probably didn't know she could use a napkin and wipe the neck. Then I ordered main course and asked to change the side because I don't eat fries. And, "we don't substitute any sides" she said. I believe to preserve the authenticity. IMHO it can't be authentic thousands miles away from the origin because all the ingredients are different.

It been while since wrote a five star review. Forte is a place that exceeded my expectations not only the food but overall experience was very unique. Lot of things that stood out for me. The fact that small family run business, off the strip not in mega hotel, very reasonable price, interior design screaming personality, and am NOT fan of Tapas style of eating but Forte made me FAN. I came to Forte with my cousins from the 808 visiting also avid yelpers and enjoy food like myself. The few times get together over the years here or back home about trying something new. I was excited too get bookmark off my list and just enjoy time around Ohana.

I knew the interior design has personality from watching the episode on DDD. What you see on television can never prepare you for the real thing. I loved every bit of it! Really small restaurant maybe holds 50 people, the bar area is also small just one row of bar stools, and the dining room is divided into two sections. Each one having its own personality. Lot of bright colors, all kinds of different tables, booths, and even the chairs few different ones so really nothing uniform or the same look around from any angle. The artwork (assume someone did) lot of Day of the Dead influence not that came as surprising since european melting pot of food. One artwork that thankfully my cousins pointed out they did Guy Fieri head with the show logo and his signature on the wall. Hell of cool! It literally feels like walking into another world once open the front door.

The food thankfully hanging out with the right peeps or Ohana this night. I got too try lot of the menu. We ordered decent amount of food for three of us. Six items in all. To go back to my earlier point reasonable price our bill was $60 before tip and we were stuffed. Two of us had drink so the bill would have been cheaper if not in the drinking mood. The HH price for drinks on all of them. Steal of deal. I stuck with beer but my cousin had one of the vodka drinks. I pass on trying but she told me was very tasty. 

Home-made chicken soup was pleasantly surprised! We all thought ok on cold night get some soup. It might be bland your basic soup. Instead this little bowl packed bowl full of goodness. The broth was really tasty had depth, ample amount of shredded chicken in it, nice portion of vegetables, and really tasted like fresh Home-made soup. On chilly day could get super size bowl be soup Happy!

Stuffed Grape Leaves was really good. I really enjoyed the filling. The ground pork or assume pork had great seasoning and flavor. The sauce brought everything together along with the grape leaves. 

Beef Stroganoff Ragu was another winnah. Again one of those dishes just give me super size plate be happy with one dish. The pasta dumplings was on point between the filling and the rich, thick, creamy, hearty stroganoff meat sauce. It heavy pasta dish but so good.

Spanish Rice (not sure forgot called) but talk about bowl of rice. It look more like paella without all the seafood or the saffron. It was popping with flavor. Not protein in it. Talk about flavors. It was really good rice.

The star of the show the one dish excited about Bulgarian Mixed Grill. Two dishes that was featured on the show. This was the one most looking forward too and past on the clay pot dish. Awesome. Not only the three different meats. I enjoy the three different sides. The beans and the red pepper something perfect compliment. If one dish NEED too order if first time, many times, or only time this is the one. 

The only dish that not fan of was the Octopus in Olive Oil. Yay it has really nice depth of Olive Oil had the Octopus. Saying sometimes can have too much of good thing. Olive Oil was the killer for me. The rice that served with was bland not very good dish overall.

Outside of the one dish everything was awesome. All the food felt like had great depth of flavor. LOVE LOVE the atmosphere very much different then most restaurants in Vegas. Great spot to hang out with family or friends over drinks, some food, and weekend they even have live music. The service was fabulous. Looking forward too my next visit!!!
good food but its Americanized Russian/Ukraine food.

Another tip from the safety girl.  You need to walk through the patio to get into this place.  The patio is too crowded with tables and umbrellas and you will need to step over the base of a very large umbrella to get across the patio and into the restaurant.  Be careful not to trip!

Ok, now that we have our safety tip out of the way, onto the restaurant.  There's a small bar towards the back with old school video poker machines along the wall.  Not at the bar.  It's more like the video poker set up you would see in a grocery store.  Lots of smokers in this area.  Interesting music videos on the TV screens.  Don't expect sports here.

We came on a Friday night and there was one waitress so service was pretty slow.

We tried the mixed tapas plate, which was just olives, garlic cloves, cheese, salumi, and bread.  Nothing exciting.

The Thracian with Lukanka was to die for.  Sausage, feta cheese, vegetables all cooked in a clay pot.  We had to ask for more bread to go with it and it took a while, but once we could dig in it was pretty good!

The blini with meat was also pretty good.  It's a thin crepe with ground beef served with sour cream.  Simple but good.  

The portion sizes are big enough to share but small enough so you can try multiple dishes.  

I liked most of the dishes but it took forever to eat here and I'm not grasping the ambience.  Maybe I am not European enough but, then again, I'm pretty sure grocery store video poker machines are not European. Still, looking forward to giving it another try.
Excellent food, great atmosphere, interesting cocktails and wonderful music. We had 5 or 6 tapas.  All fabulous.
I love this place. The food was amazing, the wine great and our waiter was so wonderful. It feels like going to Europe for dinner. It's a must try!

Forte is one of our staples, we seen to always go there when we can't agree on where to eat, and it never disappoints. I've eaten here as both a vegetarian and as an omnivore, and never had a problem having a great meal. 

We almost always order too much and leave here stuffed. Some of our favorites are the stuffed sweet peppers, the bacon wrapped dates, sofiska baniza, the goulash, and the shopska salad. My husband loves the lamb lollipops, and on this recent visit, I tried a new salad on the menu, with Persian cucumber and sliced radish--so flavorful!

I've always had stellar service here, last night the server accidentally put in an order of the sweet peppers instead of the stuffed grape leaves, but they gave us the peppers too, on the house. 

I love the pottery and eclectic art, it's always very lively feeling. 

The only reason i wouldn't give it 5 stars is the awkward seating. They swapped out several tables for high tops, and being short and stout, it's awkward for me to hip up there on my stubby little legs. The low tops are two round tables put together, which looks cute but can be problematic when you order several dishes. The last time we sat on the low top benches, they sunk down quite a bit, but those may have have been replaced when they redid the seating arrangement.

Local or visiting from out of town, Forte provides a unique dining experience, with delicious food and friendly, helpful service.  Be sure to check out their cocktail menu too - I love their sangria. Happy hour pricing looks great!

I rarely write reviews, but my experience here was too great to not. First of all, our waitress was the best. I don't remember her name, but she's Bulgarian and hilarious.
The restaurant itself is very cute. I loved the decorations, the booths were comfortable, and even the plates were cute. They started us with bread, Spanish olive oil, and that paprika mix. Already happy there. We ended up getting a few items: almond stuffed dates, stroganoff fries,  lamb chop lollipops, stuffed grape leaves, and pelmeni. Each item was better than the last. Honestly, their stuffed grape leaves were the best I can remember having. Warning that the lamb is only two pieces. Delicious, but small portion on that one. Everything else was portioned better. The pelmeni was kinda like a potsticker, in case you were questioning it.
At the end of the night, we got the biscuit cake. I will have dreams about this cake, I swear. It's like if tiramisu didn't suck, met up with some halva, and had a beautiful child. Our waitress saw that my family ate most of it while I was away from the table, so ended up bringing me an extra slice. I just about died.
It has been hours since we left, and even though I'm stuffed, I'm just waiting to go back. Not just for the food, but for the wonderful service as well.

Amazingly welcoming staff and fun atmosphere with intriguing decor. Started out with one of their wonderful vodka watermelon mint mash up drinks - delicious! Tried numerous tapas including the stuffed squid, chorizo in wine, koufta, and clay pot. Could see hanging out here for hours with friends having a great time.

Soooo good! I don't think I'm too familiar with this kind of food but everything we had was excellent! 

We tried the mix grill plate and devoured everything all the meats were so tasty but I forgot which was which but doesn't matter I would definitely order that again. My favorite was the chicken kabob plate, the rice that came with was very tasty and the chicken was awesome!

Went here with friends largely due to the DDD appearance.  Overall, we were very pleased.  We ordered damn near everything on the menu and did not have anything we did not like.  The mix of the spanish and eastern european actually works pretty well, and all the dishes we had were pretty well executed.  

From the outside, the place really is just a tiny little dive bar looking place, with some "drink, eat, play" style casino/bar type message on the outside.  Inside, it is a little bar, with a dining area next to it.  Incidentally, our friends found out they did not have any high chairs, which was a little odd, but we did just fine.  

They gave us some bread which was good and soft, and we ordered about 9-10 dishes, which were varying levels of good to great and also of value.  The tomato bread was tasty, as it came on a very soft baguette, and was decent at about $4.50.  The garlic shrimp were fine, but at $7 for 5 pretty small little shrimp, it was a bit pricey.  We also had the clay pot, which was good, but nothing that blew me away.  Also very good was the mixed grill, which we got 2 of, and came with a tasty bean salad and 3 pieces of grilled sausages.   I found them to be delicious, although they were very salty, so someone who does not care for that would not like them as much.  We had several other dishes, all of which were good.  Overall, for the 4 of us, with tax and 2 desserts, the meal was around $97, which was good considering we ordered a very healthy amount of food.  Definitely good, and the service was friendly and fast enough, although there were only a few other tables occupied.

Located in a strip mall, this restaurant is a hidden gem! My hubby heard about it from Diners Drive-ins n Dives and wanted to try it. Our waitress was really helpful and recommended several dishes to try as it was our first time eating there. She just about mentioned everything on the menu, so we decided to order 6 dishes for the four of us. Everything we tried was delicious and fresh.

You get a basket of bread to start your meal. The Bulgarian spice blend in the wooden spice box on the table, mixed with the olive oil, was so tasty! We debated getting more bread but decided to hold off for the rest of the dishes. We ordered stuffed grape leaves, Mediterranean salad, beef stroganoff ragu, the Bulgarian mixed grill, Thracian clay pot, and chicken shish kebab. We liked everything, especially the ragu, grape leaves, and mixed grill plate, and found ourselves satisfied. We ordered a baklava to share for dessert and liked that the syrup was very light and thin so it wasn't so sweet, like the kind you buy from the store. 

If we're ever back in the area, we'll be back to try more from their menu!
Wonderful food and excellent service by Ivo. This place is a hidden gem. I can't say enough about how good the food is!!! This place is a MUST go when you visit Vegas.

One the places I enjoy going in town. I like the feel of the place, all the decor and different house drinks they have are worth checking out. The beef stroganoff fries are my favorite, the goulash is great as well and the service overall is nice. The portions are a little smaller then other places compared to the price but the food is definitely worth it. One thing I learned here is about Neft Vodka. if you're a fan of Vodka, you for sure need to try it!

I ordered the lambchop lollipops & the grape leaves. 
I like the way the place was set up. When you walk in, it looks like a wine store the decor is pretty cool and the little holsters for their bottles of water they bring are also a cool touch. The food was fairly priced and good quality.

I'm still kicking myself that I haven't been here earlier. This place was SOOO cool. It feels like you've traveled to another hemisphere. The service was ok. I asked for a second complimentary bread serving & felt I got shaded by the waitress. Both my guest & I ordered alcoholic beverages, an app to share & entrees so I didn't feel like I was pushing it asking for a second helping of bread. The spices & oil that come with the bread are impossible to ignore, nom-nom-nom. And the food.... Oh Nelly... It was a cornucopia of flavors my Caucasian palate never knew it was missing & now, I'm jones'ing for another Thracian clay pot & mixed grill platter. Man that was GOOD!!!

I looooooove this place, probably the most authentic tapas places I have ever been to!
The food tastes like it was all freshly cocked with someone's own family recipe. The entire restaurant is also lined with many import European products, from Portugal to Slovakian wines and cheeses.
Had the Romanian Grill.  Consisted of four sausages, slaw, onions, and a tomatoey paste.  Lots of food for only 12 bucks.  First time trying central european cuisine.  Will be back for more.

This place is very cute and the servers are attentive. Had some European beer, was good. The bacon wrapped dates were the best part of our dinner. It was the only thing that came out hot! Everything else was lukewarm or cold. Sadly I wasn't too happy paying for a $90 dinner that was cold! We tried all sorts of tapas and the stroganoff was quite interesting. It was tasty. But it too was not hot... The stuffed grape leaves were good, but it too was not hot. Had some plate of assorted meats, it was ok, nothing that blew me away though. Also had their squid dish over rice, ugh, it was cold! The sad thing is most of our food came on metal/wood combo platter things and you would think your food would be hot....? Nope. I've been here a couple times a few years ago n forgot about this place. Drove by and said hey! I remember that place! My bf was excited to try it, but he said he's good not coming back.

This place had good, flavorful food. The service was a little awkward but maybe that was because we had two kids with us and no one else was in this dark little dining establishment. Tried a bit of everything, and while it was good for what it was, it's just not my cup of tea in terms of flavors and textures. Pricing wasn't bad, and the dates are incredible. I would definitely reccommend this place to those seeking this type of food, but I myself probably won't be back.

I do not claim to be an expert on Eastern European Food or anything close.  We tried several items including all the ones that the menu recommended with their little icon.  In the end they were all edible...filled our stomachs...provided for some nice conversation pieces...but didn't leave anyone in our group wanting to run back anytime soon.

I would have shelled out 2 stars on the food alone.  The thing is though that even though Forte is trying a little too hard to be cool and inviting, they are doing a better job with their atmosphere than a lot of places around.

The drinks from the bar are A-OK as well.  I went a little safe with a Moscow Mule and I could enjoy one or two again sometime if I ever found myself here again.

It can be tough to find scratch cooking in this neighborhood let alone authentic European technique, product and flavors. That being said Look no further, I stopped in to Forte for lunch and the first smells were freshly baked bread and roasting garlic. Greeting was really warm and I was at table with water and a menu within moments. The menu is full of intriguing and pleasantly unfamiliar terms, I love to learn new preparations when the background is this authentic. Upon recommendation of the server I had a watermelon and finely grated feta (so creamy it actually melts on your palette) salad garnished with lemon, sesame and finely cut super fresh red onion. The moisture content, texture and brightness was really wonderful on a hot summer day. I also tried the shrimp and garlic loaded with herbs and butter & wine, great contrast to the salad. So many great things on the menu to try I wish my stomach was bigger. That being said I washed it down with a nice glass of Sauvignon Blanc and I was in and out in under 30min, service was friendly and right on time! Value was wonderful so I'll be back soon for sure.
There is also a market component with charcuterie and cheeses, wine spices etc. product looks great, need to check that out when I have more time.

Went here for a quick lunch a few weeks ago.  Food was very good, cool atmosphere.  It was my first time in a tapas restaurant and I'm eager to check out some of the others around town.  I'd go back to Forte anytime.
Good food, good atmosphere.  There was a group of and we just ordered a bunch of stuff and shared.  We had a good time.  I would go back.

I want to be fair to Forte, it was busy and most people seemed to be enjoying their meals so maybe my tastes are not the norm for usual repeat customers but I was not overly impressed with the flavor palate of the food.

But the two stars is about the service, or lack thereof.  We made reservations specifying a birthday, that was ignored as were we for the first 10 minutes after being seated.   Nothing came quickly, no apologies for the slow service and we had to ask for refills to our water 3 times before anyone brought us some.  There was a large birthday celebration just beginning to set up while we were there and MAYBE that threw them off but then be aware of it and apologize to those who got bad service because of it.  I didn't see anyone who could be called a manager there.

Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and the food and recommended her favorites.  She was from Russia and I trust that what we had would have been considered good by those familiar with the food.

The decor is funky but nice, the guy playing the guitar was reserved and nicely in the background but you can't excuse the slow service.   And maybe the food was good just not up to my tastes and I do think I am adventurous.

Maybe the popularity of this place was the mention of Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives which I didn't see but they promote their appearance on it a lot.

We won't be going back or recommending it to others.

This is my favorite go-to off-the-strip restaurant in Vegas. It's in a strip mall. The food is wonderful. The owner is Bulgarian, not Spanish or Ukrainian, so try the Bulgarian spring lamb (even in winter) which was fantastic, the Shopska salad was better than the one I make (as my husband later informed me)...and the cheese banitza was worth the 20-minute wait. My Bulgarian mixed grill was the best. I do wish they would bring back the homemade bread they used to serve and I would say that on my two visits last week the service was very slow. That said, I can't wait to make it back.

Best hole in the wall in Vegas I have found. Great Beer, Great Service, and Great Food.

This is a must stop! My favorite item was the lentil soup which was super flavorful and creamy. The beer the server recommended was one of the best lagers I have ever had.

For desert we ordered this tiramisu wannabe dish that was super delicious.

I would gove them zero stars if i was able.

We took an Uber all the way there. This was not cheap.

Made reservations for this restaurant the day before. We were excited to return as we had come on our last trip to Vegas. We arrived at the restaurant and the doors were locked. We tried the other set of doors, and they we were locked as well. We pounded on the door, and we finally got a person to answer. She said, "Oh. The sign isn't there? We are closed for renovations. That's funny." We stated several times we actually made reservations. It did not matter. They were not open. We asked why they'd take reservations when they were closed? The woman who opened the door shrugged and said she didn't know.

Terrible customer service. We will NOT return. We are saddened as this was a favorite before.

Ok brace yourself... I order lamb chops med rare.... they bring them to me well done.... I hate complaining but I mean, fucking lamb chops... the waitress tells me she'll order me another one but the cooks are Bulgarian & they'll prolly come back the same way.  I can't even begin to comprehend... 

However, everything else was pretty good. Staff was super friendly and three of them spoke Bulgarian. The zagorka was a fantastic Bulgarian beer In other words don't let me keep you from trying it but I mean... you can only get your lamb chops well done?!?!?!?!? 

I can't even

I love finding off-the-strip restaurants in Vegas.  Forte was an interesting experience - our first time trying Ukrainian food.  We ordered a bunch of plates, and were happy with almost all of them.  Favorites included the beef stroganoff rago (SO good) and the kahchapurri (wished I didn't have to share this one.)  The calamari relleno was good (I liked it more than my wife did though), and we both enjoyed the dates.  Finished the meal with an order of biscuit cake, which was a satisfying ending.  Make sure you aren't in a rush though - service was very friendly, but a bit on the slow side.  Overall, a very nice restaurant, and a place with a lot more on the menu that we'd like to come back and try.

The owner was super friendly and the food was tasty, but that's really where the buck stops.  I ordered the stroganoff ragu and my dad ordered the Bulgarian mixed grill.  Both were delicious, but the portions were so small compared to the price (about $10+ a person).  For the ragu, I was expecting more than four raviolis on a bed of gravy.  Maybe some rice or bread?  The bulgarian mixed grill was much more substantial, but still left our stomachs rumbling.

The ambiance was a typical bar.  The area was dark and the music was loud.

With markets like Trader Joe's and Whole Foods selling more "exotic" foods, I can't say anything here was unusual or exceptional.

Ordered for the first time tonight. The beef stroganoff was just mushroom raviolis with some chopped meat in sauce. The portion was small for the price and very unfulfilling. The lollipop lamb chops were tough. The sausage was delicious but came in a container with fresh chopped onions which would be nice to put on the menu for those of us with food allergies.  Upsetting after all the wonderful reviews. Probably won't order again.

Came to this place out of a whim and I fell in love instantly, what a gem!  The music, the plates and everywhere you look is art, culture and color!  I recommend the Gypsy Milk and the Beef Stroganoff.  What a delightful little hole in the wall where all locals live, eat and play.  I'll be podcasting here live Friday October 30th from 9-10pm with my partner in crime Jenn Zenn.  We will also be live filming from Meerkat @foxy_roxy_show and Periscope @702rox-join the party www.702rox.com

We love this place.  We now eat here regularly, and enjoy the interesting, tasty, creative menu, the exceptionally fresh ingredients, nicely crafted cocktails, and the warm, slightly quirky ambience and friendly, helpful people.  It's our favorite place to take out of town guests to show them Vegas is so much more than the strip.  The salads are a hidden gem, and the flatbreads are beautifully balanced. The cocktails are also delicious.  Deserves an extra *

I decided to visit this after I saw in 3D @ food network. Place is very nice and you can feel the warmth. I will say service was just awesome - everyone was very caring and the owner herself comes and ask about everything so genuinely, it's really noticeable. I tried the bread with cheese and egg - server made sure I am eating it right and helped me mixed up the egg! Perfect place and awesome food.

What a treat this place is. Nice break from the heat and the commotion of the strip. We ordered the Goulash, chicken, meat plate, pierogis and their recommended dessert. Shared everything and enjoyed every bite. This will become a new Vegas tradition!

First timers here. We went to Forte after seeing it on "Dinners, Drivers, & Dives." The place was quite small but it had a quaint atmosphere.  It was also pretty packed for a Friday night. It took a long time to get seated and even longer to place an order, which is understandable. 

We ordered the Bulgarian Mixed Grill, Calamares Rellanos En Su Tinta, Thracian Clay Pot (which our server addressed that it would take 20 minutes to make), and Baklava for dessert. The food was amazing. The mixed grill was an assortment of 3 types of sausages and pickled vegetables. The Calamares was squid with spanish fried rice. It was wonderful... but we never got the clay pot. It was 40 minutes after we placed our order. We had to flag down another server to let them know we never got the other half of our order and we'll just settle with the baklava. Our server said the clay pot never went through the system. I find that hard to believe considering one of the servers tried to serve the couple next to us who was seated around the same time as us the same clay pot (which they got earlier) and then the server went back. Thankfully, we weren't charged for the claypot and the baklava was comped. 

This sort of deterred our dining experience but we'll gladly eat here again, just not soon.

Be warned - their online menu is not accurate and probably half of those things are not available anymore.  This was really disappointing to me.

I was part of April's party and she clearly paid more attention than I did so I'll just add my 2 cents.  We tried this place based on a recommendation from my Russian realtor.  

I tried the stroganoff and it was ok - not the best I've ever had but it wasn't bad.  Oh - and the rose nectar vodka - that stuff was good but man it packed a punch.  

I tried some sort of dumpling thing (what April mentioned, I think) and it was *really* good.  I wish I had ordered one of those just for me.  I tried the bread side dish (the description was similar to bruschetta) but it was boring and overpriced.  

That dessert plate the waitress brought with the pastries was excellent.  Those alone are reason to go back.  

The decor is weird - it looks like a bunch of tables taken from peoples dining rooms.  And the artwork is really weird too.

Overall I liked this place.  Its laid back and has current music playing in the background.  If you're looking for upscale this is not the place to go.  If you're looking to hang out and have some good food its worth a try.

A funky place that is reminiscent of the bar in Casablanca.  The interior is plastered with Soviet cold-war era propaganda. Kinda cool.

We only had three dishes, stroganoff, pelmeni dumplings and a shrimp dish. All very good. Plus the bread dipped into olive with the added Bulgarian spices that are on the tables. 

Looking forward to returning and expanding my knowledge of this interesting cuisine.

This is one of our favorite places to eat.

Everything we have ever had there was really good. Only exception was the Forte fries, which were good because they had feta and garlic on them, but they were just fries.

Their sausages are made in house and are awesome.
The feta melon salad is so good we started making it at home, but we still order it when we go there.
The bacon wrapped date are usually a dessert item for us, which goes really well with our last sips of wine.

Only criticism is every time we find a bottle of wine there we like, they change the wine list and we have to start over. Oh well, we love trying new wines.

I adore this place!  It's an eclectic cozy spot great for friends and families.  Good food, strong cocktails, toddlers allowed and great conversation, what more could I ask for?  Come in around 6pm on a weekend to get the full vibe of this place and its piped world music.  

They have great house bread served with olive oil and Bulgarian spices (yum), and we've tried most of the tapas, all good.  Our faves are the Spanish blue cheese (queso picon), the khachapurri (its a cross between bread and croissant with pickled cheese and a cracked egg), and you can try the chorizos as well (check out my food shots). My husband loves their Serbian burger... it's a tasty patty with buns, sour cream and diced cucumbers. If the place is packed, you have to be patient with the food service.  

Our bill for bread, 7 tapas and 5 strong cocktails was $95, good for 3-4 people.  We will definitely frequent this joint, so happy it's in our area!

My friend and I are trying out the food for the first time.  Dima our server was very helpful and friendly.  We choose 4 items off the "From Russia with Love" side of the menu. All the dumplings were fantastic. The Beef Stroganoff and the home made Chicken Soup were as Fantastic as the dumplings.  
I highly recommend this place.  We will be back.  
The prices are very reasonable.

My husband and I have wanted to eat here since we saw it on TV.  We finally got our chance.  I went in exclusively for the thracian clay pot but the waitress said it was little and not a full meal.  So I also ordered the Pelmini, which were lovely beef dumplings with dill.  DELICIOUS!  My husband got the Beef Stroganoff Ragu which was also ver delicious and my daughter got the Czar Burger.  It was a pork burger served on flatbread with French fries inside.  It was SOOOOO GOOD!  They served bread with olive oil and some kind of spice that sadly I have forgotten what it was called.  My Thracian Clay pot was amazing also.  Except it was VERY HOT -- temperature-wise.  It has a Serrano chili on top so if you can't handle chili, take it off.  The mixture of the tomatoes and peppers with the egg was magical.  The waitress was so nice and helpful, she explained everythng to us and was just great.  I only wish that the restaurant had a sister in Los Angeles.

Love this place, owner operated and chef driven.

Looking for a local spot with killer food and cocktails, this spot is for you.

Also they are on the local gifting app ItsOnMe so you can buy someone a drink here right from your phone.

OMG!!! My friend who is Croatian kept telling me to go try this place and I finally did last night!!! WOW! Funky atmosphere and damn... The mushroom dumplings with the stroganoff ragu?! To die for!  Can't wait to go back!!! Delicious!!!
**Been back 2 more times for the pelmeni dumplings with beef stroganoff ragu! And probably going to go again today!!!

Every time I go here I am impressed.  From the helpful and cheerful staff to the amazing foods and homemade alcohol infusions to the live music and eclectic people watching.  I have enjoyed every single item I have tried off the menu and that has been ample in the many visits, it's just done right every time.  I look forward to friends and family visiting the area because this is always a stop I look forward to making with them!

They have a good menu of mainly Russian food.  I love the food. Especially the pilimeny and borscht.  
The crew is nice and they serve a tasty complimentary bread and spice.   The water comes in a vodka bottle witch is awesome. 
What I don't like: the food is expensive in compression for its size.   All dishes are small.  
But I love this place.

After a long drive (9 hrs), it was refreshing to step into this friendly place.  We were seated very quickly and just as fast had bread with seasoning and dipping sauce to try.. fresh and flavorful... which also goes for the great salad, the bulgarian mixed grill (excellent) and hungarian goulash (ok but not amazing).  the salad was loaded with fresh everything and the feta cheese grated all over it was perfect.  then the biscuit at the end.. I was already stuffed but had to try this dessert which melts in your mouth.. the only thing better would have been coffee with it but it was gone before coffee could have arrived, so order your coffee in advance.  At the end of the meal Nina stopped by.  it was nice to meet her and thank her for the quality she is committed to as she brings old world foods into a modern atmosphere.  Great job of respect for family and tradition while doing something new.   Im already looking forward to my next trip to Vegas so I can come back and bring more friends.

This used to be a go-to place for me, I am sad to say that has changed. They made some changes to the menu and removed a few items I really liked, the belini for one, and the service has just gotten bad. Last 2 times I was there we had a waitress, while very nice, who didn't speak enough English to take our order. When we asked for a single sliced meat she brought us a whole platter, when we reminded her we only asked for one thing she blamed us and told us to be more clear, really?

As a long time regular visitor to LV I stay away from the strip hotels for the most part but it's hard to eliminate all the chains. Forte is now one of my favorites and I will certainly be back. The interior is divey/funky with a definite Eastern European vibe. The food is well, Spanish meets Russian meets Bulgarian and ALL good. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. The only thing keeping it from five stars is a bit of slow drink delivery but fret not even the cocktails are excellent. If you're visiting Forte is worth the field trip if you're local get over here.

Came here on Friday night for a late dinner. My boyfriend spent the past three years in Europe, so his hopes were high for quality eastern European food and this place did not disappoint!

You walk in to a cool atmosphere with lots of nick-knacks and interesting artwork. All food is tapas style, small playes that are easy to share. We tried the Hungarian goulash, homemade pickles, shrimp in white wine sauce, and a small hot pot. Everything was delicious!!! We will definitely be coming back.

Our waitress was Bulgarian (as is most of the staff, she told us) and she was extremely helpful. She even told me how to make the shrimp dish at home! Cant wait to go back!

UPDATE: We came back on 8/1/15 and were sorely disappointed. The Salyanka we ordered was so salty it was inedible. Then our entrees (burger and chicken kabob) were also painfully salty. We left hungry. :( i did tell the waiter the truth when he stopped by, telling him our food was far too salty. He offered his condolences but couldnt offer us any solution.

Gaspacho with Turkish nut is not Gaspacho.
Serbian mix - 3 days old meat! Horrible.
Bulgarian beer is good.
Shrimp tapas is good.
Solyanka different than original, but is good.
This is a great place to have multiple European cusines. Atmosphere is upbeat, and they have a great happy hour!

Amazing! The tapas plate was delicious. I ordered the borscht and grape leaves and clay pot. It was all fantastic! My first borscht ever and I am converted! Fiance ordered the meat trio flatbread (aka meat lovers pizza but so much better), the stroganoff, and the pelmini. I loved the stroganoff and pelmini best but he preferred the stroganoff and pizza. The pizza/flat bread was huge! We're both so full and the service was awesome!!! We will definitely be returning!

Amazing food!! The ajarski khachapuri is wonderful!! 
Great choices of European tapas and import beers. Definitely a must go!!

My husband and I stumbled upon this place when we saw it on TV. It was on Diners, Dives and Drive ins.....
I don't know why, because this place is soooo not any of those things. It's a cozy little restaurant with string lights and cool paintings, dim lit, verrrry cool!
On Saturdays, there's an acoustic guitar player, he plays your favorites, with his twist. Soooo fun! He remembers my fave song, and plays it for me without being prompted (hotel california ) !!!
Great family owned restaurant, the owner ,Nina is so nice she walks around and greets everyone. The servers there are all friends and you can tell, really friendly fun atmosphere. I haven't even started on the food!!!!! 
My husband is so picky, he hates everything, but he LOVES this place. He's from another country and american restaurants just don't cut it for him. They cook basic foods, hardly any seasonings, basically cooked with no feeling at all.  You can tell this food was cooked with love, you can just taste it. Such intricate flavors! I could seriously close my eyes and point at the menu and whatever I choose will be amazing! ( I've actually done that before hehe!) 
Every time we go, we bring new friends to spread the word of how amazing this place is. And we look really cool knowing a hot spot like this :)

This was amazingly tasty!! Coffee was delicious! I bought some to take home! Waitress made a fresh batch and I ended having another cup! Had some bread to snack on, the balsamic vinegar she gave us to eat was delicious and I was sad they sold out of it cause I wanted to buy a bottle! I'll just have to come back again!!! 

Had the clay pot. Took a while for it to arrive but it was worth it. Delicious!! It's also a deli too for meat, cheese, honey, etc.

Loved the food, except my husband ordered the shrimp dish.  Shrimp was over-cooked and tough.  Our waitress, Gigi was sweet, but not always aware of where we were in a meal.  She disappeared for long periods of time and didn't ask us if we wanted coffee or dessert.
Fix that problem and I would give five stars

I'm sorry but I have to retract my original review. My husband got food poisoning from their calamari. It was the only thing that we ordered that I didn't eat. I took a small bite but something in me told me I didn't like it. I have a good sense for food quality. 

My husband agreed that it didn't taste like it was bad but the calamari was not hot enough and we think it wasn't stored at proper temperatures. I've been in the food business for years.

Although most of my orginal review was accurate outside of the calamari, I can't get past the fact that my husband was sick for two days because of them. 

NEVER AGAIN.

There are toooooo many upscale restaurants in Vegas to waste time with places like this. They got lucky to land a small feature on the food network.
Great hidden away place.  Excellent food, solid liquid selections too (wine, cocktails...).  Service is excellent.  Been here 4 times, always a pleasure.  Check it out!
This place was amazing. I ate lunch there with a friend I had no idea what I was eating but the food and service was amazing.

Excellent Food, Nice Friendly Service (but slow)

I've been here at least five times now and the food is always excellent.  It's fun taking new people here to try it, especially people from out of town so they can see all the different foods Vegas has to offer.  Of course, Forte was featured on DDD, so that's always a sign of a great place.  

Everything on the menu is great.  My personal favorites are the Bulgarian Easter Lamb, Lamb Chop Lollipops, the Bulgarian Mixed Grill, the Thracian Clay Pot, and any of the salads.  The Black True Caviar with Truffle Salami Flatbread is awesome, but they don't offer it anymore.  I wasn't really a fan of the Russian dishes, but my wife loved the dumplings since they reminded her of the Ukrainian neighborhood in Chicago.  I wasn't really a fan, but I liked the Perogies we tried when we were in Poland.  With that comparison, I still didn't like the dumplings at Forte, but I'll take my wife's word for it that they are good as related to Russian ones.  

The servers are always nice and friendly.  The restaurant recently remodeled, so it is a bit more comfortable.  The music is like being in Eastern Europe with the eletronica, but it's not too loud.  The service is a bit on the slow side, so don't go here if you're in a hurry.  You might want to look at the menu ahead of time to put in a food order with your drink order since it might take a bit of time for the server to return to take your food order.

I've always wanted to come to this place and finally had a chance to this evening. I had gone on their website and they advertise that they have a Happy Hour. Certain drinks were $5 and a pitcher of Sangria $18. Also, a few appetizers on the menu were happy hour prices. We waited for a really long time before someone came over to take our drink and food order. When finally someone came over, I had asked what were the Happy Hour specials?  The waitress said they don't have happy hour and I had said, then why do you advertise it on your website. She said "I don't know, but we don't have it anymore." She said that we can order something and she would give us a happy hour price, however she would not give us the pitcher of Sangria for a happy hour price. The food I would have to say is good, but very disappointed in the service and false advertising.
Amazing! Coming back every time we are in Las Vegas! Owners are warm, welcoming and care about you...thanks!!
I very seldom give a 5 star rating. The food is terrific. Get the lamb confit. It's incredibly delicious. They serve a fantastic green tea (chilled) as well.

Disgusting and soo unpleasant!  Was dragged here with my girlfriend after a couple of my friends raved about it.  I don't even know where to start.

Atmosphere: Inside kind of looks like a bar/lounge.  Outside is a patio.  We sat inside as it's so hot out.  Unfortunately, on Fridays and Saturdays it turns into a 'club'.  Although the only people there were about 5 or 6 at the bar and our table of 6, the DJ still played the loudest, most irritating techno music throughout the whole meal.  We couldn't even talk to each other.

Food: Almost inedible!  I've had delicious mediterranean food before.  The food here was terrible.  The bread was hard.  My girlfriend called it poor man's bread.  We split the stuffed peppers and some garlic fries with herbs.  The fries were ok had they not been drenched in oil.  The peppers were so gross.  They had such a nasty flavor and were stuffed with some kind of mystery meat/rice mix.  It was all covered with a terrible white sauce with a weird dill flavor.  Our friend had a feta cheese stuffed pepper and it also had that nasty white sauce.  We ordered the tres quesos  pizza for the table and it was too cheesy and way too salty.  I prefer chuck e cheese over this!  Another one of our friends got the cheese in a clay pot and I can't even understand how that was edible.  It was hard chunky cheese and eggs with some veggies in there.  So gross.  

At one point, I had to go to the bathroom because I thought I was going to throw up.  The loud music mixed with the disgusting tasting and smelling food just put me over the edge.  

We will NEVER go back again!

I love this place. Saw it on the tube and went like several other folks......I've been several times and never been disappointed. First off, I'm the kind of gal that loves dill, pickles, tomatoes, mint, basil, feta cheese,boiled potatoes and so on.....I was married to an eastern european guy for a hot minute and the best thing about the marriage was his Mom's cooking....So needless to say, I'm a fan. Regardless though, I have a good palette and having eaten a fair amount of traditional eastern european food, I do consider myself qualified to give an opinion. Which is why I am so baffled at some of the bad reviews on this site....Seems like maybe folks, both at the restaurant and those writing the reviews might have had a couple of bad days. 

The prices? Awesome. The food? Awesome. The service? Every time I've been there, Awesome. Last time I went in I looked a hot mess having just driven 11 straight hours coming from Wyoming on a Sunday, starving like mad cause the entire state of Utah was closed for church. Which is cool for me, but I share that to say that  the circumstances of my last visit to the bistro were less than ideal. Ratty road trip clothes, hair and face, walking stiff like Frankenstein, and still, they greeted us with a smile and a cool drink. Seated us right way, the place was full, and brought us delectable treats to nom. We had wine, a roy rogers, goulash, salad and some damn good chicken meatballs and potatoes. Bill was $33 bucks. YES! AH love this place. I'll go back forever.

Very good food, the live music was less than desirable.  Love how they play house music when there is no live music.  They need to re-do their front entrance.  I have lived in this neighborhood for over a year and been to this strip mall plenty of times, never knew it existed. No way you can tell it's a delicious restaurant with the fence blocking it.

Russian and Bulgarian foods and if that is not enough some Spanish Tapas. This place is as good as it is diverse. The food is delicious and they have a great selection of affordable wines to go with the meal. I highly recommend the Spanish Chorizo Plate. Delicious. The salads were great and the Pita bread that comes with the meal is great. Just go easy because you will need your appetite for this meal. Share some plates and enjoy.
One of my favorite Restaurants in all Las Vegas ! Very unique dining experience. Everything we had was amazing ! Highly recommend anyone living in Vegas or visiting give this restaurant a try.

After seeing this local Gem on Tripe D I knew I was going to have to try them.  I love food and really love unique food that is not your normal main stream fare.  This fits that to a T.   Fist of of the interior is eclectic and inviting.  You know just from the ambiance that you are in for an experience.  
   Our waitress was from Bulgaria and she was great.  She explained their menu and the origination of the items on the menu.  I had seen the Thracian Clay Pot and was not disappointed with this amazing delight.   Although somewhat smaller than I expected it was still everything I though it would be.  I mixed everything together as instructed and just sat back and had my food moment of Zen.  
   We also had the  Ragu which was amazing also.  The Ragu part was perfectly done and the Beef Stroganoff was so creamy and tasty.  Everyone loved it and couldn't stop raving about how good it was.  We also had the Pelmini which was just a delight and the sour cream was the prefect accompaniment.  
   My main course was the Bulgarian Mixed Grill.  The sausages were all unique and very tasty.  The pepper sauce was great with the pieces of sausage.  Again everyone loved this as we shared it.  I have to say this place lived up to the hype and was the unique experience I was craving.  I can't wait to go back and try more things on the menu.
Excellent food....  super cool decor and a place worth going to. Menu is varied,  Service was great.

Forte is called "Forte" because that's exactly what their food is filled with - strength. They're a strong restaurant. To hold their fort down, outside of the restaurant are heavy-duty patio furnishings and a green metal gate with two different entrances. Just hop right in whichever side, left or right, and open the darkly tinted door. 

A server, Robert, greeted us and told us to choose a seat anywhere. There were candles to light the dining room. There was one other group that we saw and they were chatting in Russian. 

Apparently, the dining room is split in half and there are other dining tables further back and to the left side of the restaurant because the server went back there several times with food and drink.

I highly recommend trying the Selyodka, Adjarski Khachapurri, Thracian Cheese Clay Pot, and their Pelmeni Dumplings.

Selyodka: definitely fish and potatoes done right with some olive oil, dill and great pairing of flavors that really wow you

Adjarski Khachapurri: Refer to Frank W.'s review for a description. It's a great description. This one was delicious and the bread just sensational

Thracian Cheese Clay Pot: brimming with seasoning, but not overwhelming. So delicious

Pelmeni Dumplings: European jiaozi... mmm...

Very European vibe... food was excellent. I will definitely be back again!

We love taking visitors to Forte- the food and staff are great!
Last night we devoured the dates with bacon, benitzeh, angry ginger lemonade with vodka, Thracian wine, Easter lamb, Varenike potato pies with onion, Solyanka Russian soup and lentil soup. 
My Bulgarian husband went through his bakhlava like lightning!
I like the atmosphere and of course Nataliya and her colleagues are very helpful explaining the foods.
I like the music soundtrack which is fun and very European plus at times on certain nights there is really cool ethnic music.
If you have not checked out Forte, don't be the last person in town to love it!!

A great little family owned restaurant. The food was delicious and authentic. Perfect for sharing. The servers are friendly and the drinks great. I recommend the gypsy milk and sour Bulgarian cocktails.

Our friends are regulars at Forte and we joined them for dinner. On previous visits they have always had a wonderful experience. Also the Yelp reviews are positive and the visit by Diners Drive Ins and Dives was excellent. Our visit was on Saturday July 20th. The place was nearly full and included a large group celebrating a birthday.
The dining room has an Old World comfortable feeling and the wait staff is friendly and helpful. Service was excellent up to the up to the point of placing our dinner order.

Items ordered were Chicken Salad, Stuffed Grape Leaves, Hungarian Goulash and Thracian Clay Pot. While waiting, a glance around the room reveled that very few tables were receiving their food. Our server apologized for the wait and told us that our dinners would be out shortly and the entire meal with cocktails would be complementary. 
We waited one hour for our food.

The Stuffed Grape Leaves were appetizers however we received something else and it was returned and replaced with the correct item. Several other items were not up to our satisfaction. The Hungarian Goulash was over salted and the dish was refused. The Thracian Clay Pot was heavy on the cheese and light on sausage. It did not look like the one made on the Diners Drive Ins and Dives show. There must have been something seriously wrong in the kitchen on the night of our visit. I hope this was an isolated situation that the owners of this authentic European restaurant can correct. 
We would like the mom & pop places to survive.
Love the decor, and the food is great. Try the octopus! The waitress spent a lot of time with us describing the menu and cocktails. We live down the street and will probably be back soon.
Fresh and authentic.  Great Bulgarian wines at a reasonable price.  Bringing the family next time!

I was out with my 13 year old son and we were hungry.  I was in an unknown area so I turned to yelp.  One of the top ranked spots was a Bulgarian restaurant named Forte that I had just seen on Guy Fieri's DDD...so we gave it a try.

Don't let the plaza keep you from trying this place.  It's in a predominantly Hispanic plaza anchored by a Mexican market.  My son thought I was joking when I pulled in.  However, the restaurant inside was quite nice.  It felt like a funky restaurant that you would find in San Francisco.  Cool colors, cool posters, and a good mix of deep house music playing on the speakers.  

Once we walked in we were greeted by some beautiful servers in tight black striped dresses.  Behind the bar was the even more beautiful owner that I saw on TV.  She was charming and I told her that we were there because the show.  

We sat down and our server (I think her name was Nataliya) brought us a loaf of homemade bread and water in a recycled bottle of vodka.  She instructed us to dip the bread in olive oil with an optional mix of Bulgarian spices.  Delicious.  

We happened to be there in the last hour of happy hour so I ordered their Angry Lemonade (delicious cocktail with lemon juice, mint, vodka, and a sprig of rosemary).   They serve this in an attractive copper mug.  

My son ordered a sprite but the nice touch was the carafe of sprite that they left for refills.  

As I said, we were hungry so we ordered the Bulgarian mixed grill, garlic fries, Serrano & Arugula pizza, and Gambas Al Ajillo (delicious shrimp sauted with garlic, white wine, and other herbs).   

I was a little disappointed that the fries came first, but they were delicious.  They looked like McDonald's fries covered with herbs and garlic.  Only $5.

The shrimp came next and these were unbelievable.  It was so good that we immediately ordered another.  The shrimp were cooked perfectly and the white wine sauce was so good that we asked for another loaf of bread so we could dip it.  Only $7.

The pizza was mediocre.  Generous amount of Serrano and arugula...possibly too generous because it was a bit salty.  The texture made it tough to eat.  I don't think it was cooked long enough.  The dough was soft and the pizza was a bit runny.  We are less than half of this and took the rest home.  

The mixed grill was as delicious as we saw on TV.  Homemade sausages grilled with an delicious bean relish and this tomato sauce.   Only $11 for this plate.  Wow!!

Service was excellent.  The food was delicious and very reasonable.  The ambience was hip.  This is clearly a restaurant that is well-run with attentive owner-operators.  

We will be back with the rest of the family.  I would return to the bar for the beautiful servers.  They were hot!!

Cute lil spot off the strip.  When  I was reading the reviews, there was a few complaints about the cust. Ser.  Even though I believe there is rarely a good reason to provide bad service.  We decided to give them a try anyway, so glad we did.  Upon arriving we were promptly greated and seated.  Forte is cute and clean. (See pics) we got there about 8:45pm on a Monday evening.  There was only 1 othere fam. there.  Our server was prompt and eager to help with the menu once he heard we had never been there before.  All our food arrived in a timely manner with the exception of the clay pot.  Now I'm not complaining, this is just a heads up.  I knew this going in so we were patient.  Everything came out very hot and with great presentation and it was all as good as it looked.  We will definitely be going back.  Btw.  The clay pot was awesome.  Next time we will order it upon arriving since it does take about 35 min to make.  I guess you can't rush perfection.

In Las Vegas, many of the really interesting places to eat are overrated, overcrowded, and overpriced.  When I saw Forte featured on "Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives," I was skeptical that the food could be as delicious as it looked and sounded.  But wow, I'm so glad I tried it and found out that I was totally wrong - this is excellent food and drink, in a lovely atmosphere with great service.

The location is definitely more for locals than Strip-visiting tourists, so I'm glad that we had rented a car (to spend our days at Red Rock Canyon and the Valley of Fire).  At first, it wasn't clear that they were open, because the windows are dark (an open sign would aid walk-in business), but we trudged through the patio area and went inside and were met with a gorgeous colorful interior!  It's a fun and eclectic space, I really loved the style.  (The men's room is particularly awesome, decorated in crazy Eastern European propaganda posters.  Or so I hear.)

The table bread was fantastic, especially dipped in oil with their hand-blended spice mix.  We could've eaten tons of it!  Everything on the menu and specials board was enticing, but we finally settled on a bunch of small plates: Adjarski Khachapurri (really fun dough boat, enjoyed the egg on top), Thracian clay pot (smaller than expected, everything inside was tasty), chebureki (dumplings so deliciously flaky and dill-y that we ordered a second round), kebabche (one of the sausages we saw on the show, as delicious as we'd hoped it would be), and the Bulgarian bean relish (refreshing, something I'm going to try to make at home).  I also got two tasty beverages - the angry ginger lemonade (delicious, not at all boozy) and a bloody mary made with their garden veggie-infused vodka (this was so amazing, I need to infuse my own vodkas immediately).  I was stuffed by the end of the meal and still longing to try more things!

The best part?  It was an incredibly affordable meal, especially for the quality and quantity.  You can easily eat a great meal, with drinks, for $25 per person.

I keep coming here and even ordered delivery from Bite Squad. Please don't change a thing...the flavors in the dishes are crazy good!  One of my favorite spots! 
Ok..try like everything.  

They have the best seasoning, right at the table. Mix it with the oil for your bread. The octopus on rice has so much flavor.  We usually get the lamb and beef confit..it has pickles also to enhance the flavor.  The fries are crisp and perfect. Never burnt or soggy. Pelmeni is so good, I'd come just for that.  Whatever cheese they use in the breads...are fresh and flavorful. The thracian clay pot is a must try. The egg on top is runny, but it's good.  Pierogis are good too. Can't remember the name of the serbian dish we had,  but it's a burger with a cheese spread and chopped onions.  The meat is seasoned and has a very nice spice combo,  which is situated with tender bread. It's actually really big, so share it with someone if you're planning to eat other tapas.

Decor is funky with an underground appeal, very cool and not overdone. Service is always excellent.  Sadly I posted this after deleting pics off my phone,  otherwise I'd have a few.

I wasn't crazy about this place. I went after it was featured on one of Guy Fierri's shows a couple of years ago and remember not being impressed. Fast forward to 2014. . . fool me twice.  We ordered the *octopus, *beef stroganoff fries, *Chartreuse platter and *lamb lolipops. $49.00 later we are still hungry and not impressed. We were the only ones eating lunch there on a Friday afternoon at 12pm. Hmmm. ... 

PROS: The interior is awesome
             
CONS: Small portions - big prices

Had some hits and misses with this place. I always re-order the same thing after some of the "misses". Now it's just shopska salata and Adjarski Kachapurri (spelling may be off). Mixed drinks, I've had better. Wine list, not too shabby. Some of the servers aren't the sharpest knife in the drawer. Service can be a bit slow. It takes forever to get your bill.

Pretty sure this is the most eclectic hidden spots for relatively authentic Baltic and Spanish cuisine at a gypsy style tavern.  There is a dizzying diversity of dishes that only a Traveler will experience.

From the minute that you're greeted at the door until you pay your bill, you'll be treated like royalty. 

The first time that I walked into Forte, the owner, Nina, came over to introduce herself and tell us about her menu. Now YEARS LATER, Nina still is the same fun, gracious owner that she was in the early days. 

And the food!!! It really doesn't matter what you order, it WILL BE OUTSTANDING!!! You know how some restaurants lose quality over time, NOT FORTE, they just keep getting better and better. 

Diners, Drive Ins and Dives Guy Fieri did a segment about Forte. He couldn't say enough great things about Forte and they are ALL true. In fact, I believe that Nina and her father, Stephan were the only people to ever PUNK Guy. It was hilarious. 

Anyway Nina and Forte get my highest praise for food quality and atmosphere. Give it a try, you won't be sorry. Just come hungry.

I was invited along with a group of a friend's friends... and I had eaten earlier in the evening, so I wasn't in full restaurant exploration mode, but still, even from the few things I nibbled on, I was impressed and am looking forward to a return trip.

Highlights for me were the Adjarski Khachapurri and stroganoff, though I didn't snag a bite of anything that was less than tasty.

Also, I was enchanted by the painted glass my cocktail arrived in, it was deemed instagram worthy! After checking out their website, it seems it was painted by the owner herself, which between that and her "punking" of Guy Fieri (also viewable on the website) leads me to believe she's a pretty neat lady.

Can't wait to go back with an empty stomach and an eager dining companion.

This place is a nice hidden gem in Vegas.  You would not expect the quality of food or the ambiance of the place from the outside.  The food is delicious, has a wide variety, and is pretty authentic.  Many of the people working there have an eastern European decent, so that is always a good sign to know you're getting a quality meal.

I came in during the 4-7pm daily Happy Hour and had a few drinks, the stuffed dates, and the chicken paprikash.  All was very good and unique to the area.  The menu consisted mostly of Bulgarian, Hungarian, and Russian cuisine, but also had some normal tapas selections as well.  The cocktails were tasty but a little light on the alcohol content.

Overall I really enjoyed my meal here.  The restaurant is pretty small but nice.  Happy Hour is the way to go for $5 cocktails and beers and then order your tapas or meals alongside.  I will be back in the future to sample some other dishes and experience other eastern European dishes.

Unique restaurant, worth the $30 taxi ride from the strip (pre uber/lyft). The russian Vodka called in Russian Oil Vodka was really smooth. I have been trying to find it but haven't so far. Get a variety of plates and enjoy
Fantastic food! The Hungarian gulash is my absolute favorite. The mashed potatoes and sausages are incredible here too. Awesome atmosphere inside as well.

If you claim to be a foodie you have to try this place.  The location of the restaurant is questionable but it makes it a neighborhood gem.  Ask you server what they recommend and enjoy being transported to Europe!

The service was fast and excellent.  Take a look at the beer selection as well.  Personally I recommend the Hungarian Goulash!
